Reviews.Title: “An OK stay in Sydney..”
Reviews.Author: braapz
Reviews.Content: A mixed experience with the Blue Hotel. The hotel is definitely quite stylish with a warehouse conversion look by the Cowper Wharf. The location is good for business travellers as it is close to the CBD but still far enough for relaxation in the evenings. It is also connected to some of the best restaurants in Sydney. Loft rooms are nice with separate living room downstairs but the bathrooms can sometimes be too small. The breakfast room service costs is ridiculous. You are charged per sausage piece and per bacon rash. There is no all inclusive American Breakfast. The Water Bar is a nice quiet spot during the week to get a drink. There is hardly any crowds and you can chat with your partners and friends comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Wait for a Refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGalQld
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel from outside and cool interior. Staff as described in reviews here, walkie talkies, efficient etc. Booked a Pier Loft Room and to say we were disapointed is an understatement. Think dark, pokey, stained carpets, moudly grouting in bathroom, stains on sink. Bathrooms so tiny its like you are staying on a boat. On the plus side it has a cool bar and its in a fabulous location. We walked to Surry Hills/Paddington/City/Circular Quay/Potts Point/Kings Cross etc. Unfortunately it just has very VERY tired rooms. Would give it a 3 and a half, 4 star max. Its like schoolies have stayed a week before you. Generally clean but needs a good scrub. Needs a major in room refurbishment to call itself a 5 star hotel. New paint, carpet, bathroom clean and something over the windows so you dont have to look at the terrible view would be a start. Has great potential but Taj if thats the quality of your hotels we won't be booking any of them any time soon. Hope they renovate as then it would be fab. People if you like 5 star finishings don't stay here til they do. Also if you are tall be aware you will have to watch your head everywhere and seriously duck to look out the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Blue”
Reviews.Author: DebMum
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. Tjhe staff were very friendly and helpful, and we cannot thank Chief Concierge Andrew enough for his assistance before and during the trip. This hotel is in a great location, 15 minutes walk through the Botanic Gardens to Circular Quay. There's a pub, restaurants, sandwich shop, bottle shop, pie van and convenience store all just outside the front door. Lovely pool and deck, all in a fascinating building. A loft room is recommended - no problems with noise, and we preferred the naval base side (cooler and no glare). Fablulous, would not stay elsewhere whenever we are back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky place to stay by the water that is quieter than central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ivor T
Reviews.Content: Built in an old warehouse building on the wharf with great restaurants, open spaces and walks to hand, this unusual hotel has character and style. The access is a bit restricted but valet parking is on offer. Room access is limited to one slow elevator with a slightly eccentric control system which can be mildly frustrating as there is no alternative staircase available. The superior room I enjoyed was most comfortable with a very attractive bathroom. However it was very difficult to adjust the temperature on both the slow running bath and the shower and it took a little experimenting to find how to get a comfortable water temperature with diametrically opposite tap settings. The room I stayed in was exposed to noise from revellers in the street nearby at the weekend but that comes with the territory in such a characterful building. The room turn down service and servicing was the best I can recall encountering, however some of the front desk staff let the side down. They gave the appearance of being inflexible and unhelpful, and resorted to bluff on occasion rather than admit they didn't know giving the impression that they were not experienced or well trained. More senior desk staff were available on request and speedily resolved all issues. But I felt the impression created let the side down.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Old Woolen Mill”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler80
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently while visiting Sydney for the first time. Rooms were good size, nicely decorated, clean and wonderful view. The building was an old woolen mill and kept the original beautiful wooden beams, bar is fabulous! Staff were friendly and helpful!! The location was great during the day as its a good walk through the Botanical Gardens but at night it's not as convenience although they have a lot of good restaurants at the wharf. Really enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gunda_10
Reviews.Content: Great location, loads of restaurants,pubs,cafes etc in the area. Really close to the Art Gallery and Botanical Gardens (about a 10 minute walk). The hotel is inside an old building on the wharf at Woollomooloo where they used to handle and ship wool. Beautiful big timber beams and original features throughout, really nice & rustic. The staff are really friendly and the rooms clean, comfortable and good. Bed really comfortable and great pillows too. Breakfast in the hotel was fantastic, just like breakfasts should be. They had a really nice looking buffet with lots of fresh fruit, cheeses and the usual hot food things, but we chose the al la carte option. Beautiful fresh orange juice and eggs benedict was perfectly done, could not fault it. They don't have a restaurant in the hotel which you don't need as there are so many good ones close by. (Try Aki's indian, excellent!) However they do have 24 hour room service which we did not use so can't comment on that. Really nice bar in the hotel, pool, gym etc for those needing to work out, and for the runners really good area for jogging. Would definitely be back as it is such a good location, the only thing as the hotel is heritage listed they do not have any outside areas or balcony's in the hotel. (However all the restaurants underneath are outdoor eating with heaters etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JoSaint51
Reviews.Content: I think the location is good because the walk through the Botanical Gardens to everywhere is so interesting and there are many restaurants nearby. All the staff were very efficient, friendly and helpful. Our room at the top on the marina side had a disappointing view of the road rather than the marina although good for people watching. I booked a room with a split level accomodation because it sounded rather interesting but I'm not sure the design of the room works very well as the bedroom was upstairs and the wardrobe was downstairs so you need to be organised or take many walks. The bathroom was so tiny and there is nowhere to put anything. I think the decor and furnishings are beginning to look a little worn. I would stay here again but in a different type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: andyka
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to end our stay in Sydney. We had a Luxury Marina View room with the Sydney skyline in the background. Large room, very clean and comfortable. Big bathroom with separate bath and shower. Service at reception and bar was excellent, even allowing use of the spa after check-out. First class.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, rooms big but are starting to show wear.”
Reviews.Author: phukdesign
Reviews.Content: This is a good sydney hotel and for the price makes it a good option when visiting the city. It is a little out of the way of the CBD, but to be fair it is only a 10 minute walk to MArtin place and probably a nice 15 min walk to opera house through Botanic' gardens. The service is very professional and of a 5 star standard. I mean military "mission impossible " perfect - the receptionist greets you by your name before you even get to the desk as the concierge who takes your bag as you approach the entrance has a bluetooth headset on and must tell them. The pool/gym is a bit of a walk from the main hotel and is shared with local apartments by the looks of things. Nice facility if a little small. The rooms are of a very good size for a major city and have nice views of the marina. I would say they are starting to date and need taking to the next level if they are to compete with the other hotels in Sydney. It used to be a W hotel which is a very good brand and have lovely hotels across the world, I am not sure what Taaj have done to it ? If anything ? But some new furniture would not go a miss. The bathrooms are very big and have a big double shower and separate big bath. Great size to be fair. I would stay here again, but I think I will wait for the refurb. I have a few other hotels I am going to try first.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, got it right...”
Reviews.Author: imaginelle
Reviews.Content: I have always loved the location of this hotel and although it has changed management quite a bit over the years, I think the Taj group possibly have got the feel about right now. I enjoyed the little bit of showmanship by being greeted by the concierge, asked my name and when escorted to the reception, found the front desk receptionist already 'knew my name" and greeted me as such. (Yes courtesy of the little speaker connected to the concierge and teh reception 'overhears' the name). We were taken to our loft by the same concierge who was very friendly and helpful...yet, alas, the magic of this whole process waned a little when less than 10 minutes later, my husband returned from parking our car and the same concierge greeted him and asked whether he wanted to check in! Loft had everything you could need, nice view of the pier and was roomy enough. We went to the Water Bar for cocktails prior to our night out, groovy ambience, which surprisingly wasnt busy. The attention to detail was very good,although the cocktails were a little below par and they took a little too long to be delivered by the waitress after the barman had made them. All in all, a great value- for- money hotel, close to great restaurants and the art gallery and gardens. I would certainly use the Blue again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent staff, but a bit far away from most things”
Reviews.Author: sue1501
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and got an early check in without any problems which was really nice. The staff were excellent and very pleasant and helpful. We chose a loft room for something a bit different, but the room was a lot smaller than it looked on the website. The loft bedroom had a tiny wardrobe, but there was another full sized wardrobe downstairs so that was more convenient to use, which meant going up and down the stairs if you needed anything. There was always a line of taxis waiting out the front, but everything eg town, theatres etc are at least a $20 or $30 taxi ride away. Having a hire car or taking your own car isnt worthwhile as parking is $50 per day. There is a little restaurant and a bar within the hotel, but we didnt try them....though they both looked quite popular. There are many other restaurants on the wharf under the hotel and Harrys Cafe de Wheels (a Sydney Icon) very near the front of the hotel. In summary the Blue Sydney is a really lovely hotel with a couple of minor space issues. The staff are lovely but the location needs to be taken into account as the cost of taxis add a lot more to what is already a higher priced hotel. If you want a quiet weekend away and are happy to stay close to the hotel and you dont want noise and the hustle and bustle of the city - then this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfixation
Reviews.Content: Quick visit to Sydney and a great time. The hotel has some real character and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a Deluxe Marina view room very large however would probably opt for a loft next time as we faced the street and was a little noisy good for people watching. The room as mentioned was very spacious and the location was great easy to access most of Sydney. Breakfast was nice nothing fantastic but more than acceptable. Overall a very nice stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vve007
Reviews.Content: I come to Sydney on business regularly and this is the best hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Pink H
Reviews.Content: I had read a tripadvisor review before booking - so I had some advance knowledge. On the money - Great night

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: sunnynz1
Reviews.Content: Excellent option for business or holiday. Feels 5 star but with more character and atmosphere than a regular big chain hotel. My room was on a corner and therefore very spacious with a huge bathroom. Nice outlook over the wharves. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull location - spectacular building”
Reviews.Author: David-Christine
Reviews.Content: The Blue Hotel is in a spectactular building at Woolloomooloo not far from down town sydney. The rooms are excellent, although as we staying both types the loft rooms are alittle small in the upstairs bedrooms. The pluses are the loctaion, building and wonderfull restaurants in the same building, peirside dinning on the wharf. Highly reconmended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LyndhurstPrahran
Reviews.Content: Had not stayed in this part of sydney before and loved every moment The hotel is great, clean, modern and funky. Room was very good without being outstanding. Excellent food nearby, easy access to the Barbour tunnel by car. Short walk to circ quay. Service was excellent. Can't fault the place and I would return in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, room good not great”
Reviews.Author: DMulvee
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal in Woolloomooloo near the steps from which the Art Gallery of NSW is easily accessible. The staff were helpful. Room size was generous but split level, though the bathroom was small. Breakfast was so-so (very few other guests) whilst room service is ok. Many other good food options exist in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: haydenvink
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled over to Sydney from New Zealand for just one night to see Erykah Badu play at the Opera House (fantastic concert by the way!). A friend had recommended Blue, and I thought it looked perfect . . both in terms of building/accommodation, as well as location - walking distance to both CBD and Botanic Gardens (and round to Opera House). We checked in about 11am Monday morning, and were surprised to learn our room was ready . . only problem was there was a bit of a mix-up (Blue's fault) with the booking and we'd been given a room with view of the pier (looking out to Pott's Point) rather than the city. This was quickly resolved by the manager, who upgraded us to a Lunar Loft Suite - a fantastic, and greatly appreciated treat! Our porter described these rooms as the "best in the house", and it was clear to see why - a two-level suite, with huge lounge / dining room on ground floor, and loft-style bedroom and bathroom on second floor. Blinds on the big windows and skylights could be opened to reveal great view out past Woolloomooloo Wharf towards the city. In short, the room and its various amenities were superb. The location suited us just fine - we'd bought our running gear, and went for a nice run through the gardens and around the waterfront to the Opera House and back. We walked into town to meet friends - there are numerous paths 'up and over' the hill to the CBD. We caught a couple of taxis to/from the hotel - easy. And we caught the City Explorer bus from the stop right outside the hotel too. We really wish we could have stayed longer, and hope to visit again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Whwhib
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Sydney for a night and would normally stay over in the main city area. Reading a few reviews of this place they seem to be mixed. We certainly didn't have any issue although it could have been interesting.. We started with Valet parking which I read was as easy as arriving at the doorstep. It was. The German guy (Nicolas) who greeted us and took the car was fantastic and certainly raised the service bar from the start. He was friendly, interested and happy to talk and greet us to the hotel. Great start. Walking into the hotel the team greeted us and took the very few bags we had and waited while we checked in. Checkin was simple and we were shown to our room, shown how to work everything and left to enjoy the fairly unique view over the docks with Warship and Queen Mary 2 in sight. 1 small hiccup, on checking our booking we had booked a different style room. I walked down and pointed this out and was compensated with breakfast being included and to apologise they sent up a bottle of red wine. A great way to start a dinner date. While this was happening the staff (Kate, Front Desk) was apologetic and seemed to genuinely be sorry that the mistake had occurred. Our room was a king room on the pier side, the bath and bathroom were great and we had no trouble with noise. I expect when the Waterbar is very busy, noise might be interesting as our room door was about 20 feet above the floor level of the bar. Midweek it was quiet and the city seemed far away. We walked along the pier in the evening and the next morning walked over to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Great walk and such a great view of the city. I would love to stay longer and explore the area more on foot. For dinner we took a taxi (lazy us) to Kings Cross and had a great meal at a Japanese restaurant and walked back down the hill to the hotel. Breakfast was one of the best we have had in a hotel. Fresh, enough choice and the service (Krishna) was attentive and friendly. They knew who we were and that breakfast had been included. Would love to see the rooms on the two upper floors but I was very impressed with the amenities and the level of service in a hotel that is a short walk from the CBD across the Domain. Super.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and light and great views”
Reviews.Author: RubyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Blue was for 2 nights, Thursday and Friday. The position was okay and there were taxis outside most of the time. We had a room on the lower floor which was overlooking the marina and it was very comfortable with a nice large bathroom although the basin was a bit on the small side. The beds were very comfortable there was internet access which cost $15 a day, a large flat screen tv,. The bar goodies were quite expensive so we bought some nibbles from a shop over the road. My only critiscism is that the noise from the restaurants downstairs on the marina and from the Hotel dining room or lounge, wafted up til quite late and disturbed our sleep. The staff were really helpful with anything we asked for and the door staff and concierge went out of their way to offer assistance all the time. Also a lot of road noise so I would ask for a room higher up or on the pier side I think next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish waterfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janekiwi
Reviews.Content: Restored woolshed on Woolloomoolloo wharf; part hotel and part private apartments. Small gym, indoor pool, various (pricey) waterfront eateries also in building. Loft rooms are two-level, living down and bed/ensuite up. Lovely views, a little out of city centre, but a beautiful nice walk through the gardens into town. Chic, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Into the Blue....even if the sky wasn't”
Reviews.Author: TraLou
Reviews.Content: The weather was not that flash, but the hotel was! The former W Hotel in Sydney is now part of the Taj group and what a great job they have done. Fantastic staff, super attentive and boutique uber chic lodgings right in Sydney...best part is you cannot go wrong with any of the restaurants that lie along the wharf below. We also conferenced at the hotel which made it all just soooo much easier and more enjoyable and felt like you got to linger in this lovely hotel just a little bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “another good stay”
Reviews.Author: SLMAust
Reviews.Content: stayed here again for work great big room two double beds i just didn't have enough time to use the bath! location i think id great next to the bot gardens so great to have a jog in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Great to be on the water”
Reviews.Author: Karina1912
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a loft suite which was very nice but smaller than I was expecting. It was great to have a second wc on the lower level and the decor of the room was very nice. There was nowhere to hang used towels in the bathroom which was a bit of a pain as we had to use the railing of the loft bedroom but the view was great and I could not fault any of the staff members we spoke to. They were all courteous, helpful and extremely friendly. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Taj”
Reviews.Author: Nowandthentraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister and mum for one night at the Blue Taj Hotel. We stayed in a King suite loft. It was a great size. There is a toilet downstairs and a bathroom upstairs. The bed is really comfortable. The decor is modern and cosy. They had little things like an ipod docking station, iron (with a proper iron), chocolates by our bed. Which were nice touches. The valet parking was $40, but definitely worth it. It made life convenient as we were able to just drive to the front of the hotel and hand over our keys. It was also great as the next day we just left the car there and went shopping. The valet got the car for us later and they also held our bags for the day. So saved us trying to park in the city the next day. The service was five star. Anything we wanted was not too much trouble. They have a 24/7 button on the phone to call. We had room service in the morning. We ordered and had our food in 15 minutes which was very impressive. The food was lovely. Check out the bar down stairs as well. I will definitely stay here in the future. My new fave in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: frankiejholden
Reviews.Content: Blue sydney is a great hotel, well located, with friendly and helpful service staff. The interior design of the hotel is interesting and unique and the facilities, with pool and gym are quite good. I did find the gym a little small, but similar to many that i have seen before. The service staff were really what set this hotel apart, they were eager to please and went out of their way a number of times to assist us as tourists in melbourne. I'd recommend staying here if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome change”
Reviews.Author: Herriotcube
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Blue for three nights and enjoyed the experience a great deal. The hotel itself occupies a unique wooden building (originally a cargo handling facility) at the wharf of Wooloomooloo. The rooms are uniquely designed to a very high standard and are well equipped (as you would expect from a 5 star hotel). The true beauty of the hotel is that they maintain 5 star standards in a beautifuly designed setting with staff who are very approachable and down to earth.. Pricing-wise, this is not an expensive hotel given the location and the standard of the service provided and I would strongly recommend this hotel for both business and personal trips.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Blue is a great option!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyRubinAtl
Reviews.Content: We were trying to stay close enough to the 'heart' of Sydney, but not for the 'price' of hotels in the 'heart' of Sydney. The Blue was absolutely a perfect choice. We could walk to all main attractions (Opera House, Bridge, etc.), and were situated across from a lovely park. The staff at the hotel could not have been better. They are there to greet you outside, suggest different attractions, restaurants, etc. The hotel itself is a converted factory and has an amazing amount of charm and history. Since it is not in the immediate downtown area, it is very quiet at night and you are removed from the hustle and bustle of city streets, noise, and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a lovely hotel with awesome pillows”
Reviews.Author: yank7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were dining at China Doll for our anniversary and decided to throw a hotel stay in the mix. We live in Sydney and thought it would be nice to "get away" for the night and we managed to get a last minute rate. Very welcoming staff. We stayed in the Deluxe Pier King room. The room was clean and tidy as was the bathroom. It had one of the biggest bathtubs I've ever seen in a hotel. The bed and super comfy pillows made for a very good nights sleep. The pool was nice although it was a little confusing getting there with certain lifts not going to our level so we had to walk through the public area of the hotel to get to the pool. We had a cocktail at the hotel bar and the barman made one of the best mojitos we've tasted. Being able to dine on the wharf and then simply walk upstairs to our room was a treat. 11am checkout allowed a great sleep in and we didn't feel rushed. Many hotels these days have complimentary Internet, the Blue does not. A good choice if you want to stay in the Woolloomoolloo area, away from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a bit away from the buzz”
Reviews.Author: Vaniades
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blu Sydney for three night in January. The hotel design is Impressive, and the staff was friendly. The room was very small (we booked into a deluxe room) and the shower room very tiny. The location is good, but not for those looking for buzz and nightlife, as it is a bit remote from the centre. There is a nice walk across the botanic garden that leads to the Opera House. Good pubs in front of the hotel and a wide selection of restaurants. However, as said before, the location is not in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel. Good value...???”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_Stewart
Reviews.Content: I would ideally rate Blue a 3 1/2, but that's not an option, so I went with 4 to be generous. Stayed for a weekend (Friday/Saturday). Overall impression is that it was nice place to stay, but doesn't quite live up to its former glory. I mean there's nothing wrong with the hotel - It must have been hugely impressive when it first opened. But it is showing it's age & all feels a bit worn by now. We stayed in a loft suite, which looked over the wharf & water & provided glimpses of the Harbour bridge & city. The room had a living area downstairs and the bedroom & en suite up. Nice enough room, but the bedroom was rather cramped. The first night we stayed, the hotel's main bar (the Water Bar, which runs the entire middle of the hotel, and that all rooms overlook) had been booked for a private function. Which didn't phase us, as we were heading out that night, but the event went to midnight & was very noisy. Think hundreds of guests, DJ's, yelling/screaming - all quite easily heard from the room. Again, we were still having a night cap at midnight so we didn't care, but we overheard many guests complaining the following morning at breakfast. So keep that in mind if it might be of concern to you. The location is great. Some nice restaurants in the area (China Doll comes highly recommended) & we had a fun afternoon at the Tilbury hotel around the corner. So overall, I liked it, but I'm not sure if it was worth the $400 a night we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff, arrogant manager.”
Reviews.Author: Mickytickler2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel great location but unfortunatly there staff ruin it. After going for a meal at one of the restraunts along the boardwalk we desided to have a night cap at the bar. There was no one else in there, we tried to order a couple of beers and a couple for cocktails. To our amazment 2 of the people where told they would not be served as they where intoxicated. This was not the case at all as we only had 2 bottles of wine with dinner between 5 people. This is where in get's interesting he asked to speak to the manager and the manager was basicly just fobing him off and then said he wasn't going to serve anyone! We then realised these painfull staff and managment just wanted to shut up the bar early.It is a shame as we where looking at booking this hotel for a future confrance where we would have at least 25 to 30 rooms booking

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Castor T
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in more than fifteen properties of Taj group of hotels worldwide, SYDNEY Blue canâ€™t match up the Hype and I would call it a disappointment, tired interiors stained carpets and poor lighting in the evening what is called ambience looks pathetic not to mention the arrogant duty manager and they say itâ€™s not like other Taj hotels it is a boutique hotels well am I surprised to know that if itâ€™s got to be like this. On my five nights stay I can very well say the staff is struggling to keep up. The area where it is located and the concept are worth a visit but spend $400 a night to find out what one gets. What I liked is the bed, housekeeping service and the restaurants around it. I will not recommend this hotel for young and enthusiastic couples. I have already made a mistake

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BarryJ_100
Reviews.Content: Its a 10 to 15 minute walk from the city and next door to the Woolloomooloo wharf. Its just a few minutes fabulous wharf to Lady Macquaries chair through the gardens -- just a great location the rooms are really nice with fabulous spacious bathrooms and big suites.Great helpful service at the kerbside and reception - they couldn't be more helpful. the rooms were also well equipped and really comfortable and quiet. A couple of 'downers' though -- its a luxury hotel at luxury prices and they still believe in 2011 that WiFi is an extra and should be paid for - just ridiculous, and also to charge another 1.5% to use your credit card is just not understanding their customers -- who rocks up to the desk in a luxury hotel to pay with cash. ,Its crazy and again, just ridiculous, and shows management just out of touch. But a great hotel in a great location - most people who can pay the price would love it..

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel near the city”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: This is a great trendy hotel. The building used to be wool stores and it's been very tastefully redeveloped into a hotel, very expensive apartments and excellent restaurants. The good, valet was very fast and prompt. The staff are excellent. The room I had was large, clean and functional. The bathroom was large and well laid out. There are numerous restaurants in the same building and good quality pubs very close by. You can walk into the city in about 10 minutes. The bad, it can be very noisy outside which is annoying if you are in the front rooms. The space for pulling up to valet parking is small and busy with taxis stopping, as a result you can be on the street trying to get in for a while. Nothing else bad. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy, noisy, gloomy, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Marc-PhilippeG
Reviews.Content: It all starts with a good idea, i.e.: renovating an old building along the quay and turn it into a hotel. Good. But once you step inside, itâ€™s cold, dark, no lights, kind of gloomy. Reception is fine, though. I booked a loft suite, not cheap (AUD 400), the inside is pretty nice. Major issue: itâ€™s not a TAJ hotel as you might know them in India, refined and elegant, itâ€™s rather some kind of self-designated â€œtrendyâ€� place, and the hotel is organized with a bar / lounge that covers the entire 1st floor, while rooms are locating along two long corridors overlooking that giant lounge. The result is simple: do not except any rest and peace before 1 a.m., as itâ€™s partying and drinking down there. Itâ€™s even dull, as you can see hookers entering or exiting late at night or early in the morning. You do actually all sort of weird people entering/exiting the placeâ€¦. Anyway, sound insulation (windows, doors..) is not good overall, so itâ€™s a place to party, not to relax or sleep. Lifts are terribly slow, air conditioning kind of noisy. Youâ€™ll find the very, very minimum amenities in the room. There is no more Spa, which is now closed (well, itâ€™s more of a large pub than a hotelâ€¦) I had much better breakfast in 3 stars hotels: food is cheap, really, but not the price. Better go to the breakfast shop opposite the hotel. I strongly do not recommend this hotel unless you like dull places and late coktails

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, nice overall”
Reviews.Author: jetssc
Reviews.Content: The location is really great, especially for leisure. Rooms are nice, concierge services very efficient, and there is a pleasant hype which does not come with noise and leaves you choose your pace. The building hosting the hotel is quite unique and being at the doorstep of the botanical garden is a real plus (easy jooging, nice walk to the Opera House). There are several nice restaurants literally next door for outdoor dining - in case you do jot really want to move.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the hype”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Melbourne Cup day on route to the USA and couldn't have picked a worse venue. The bar section that we wanted to drink at prior to arriving was closed for a private Melbourne Cup function and all the restaurants which are along the wharf were completely full with functions of their own. We basically couldn't get anywhere to eat locally and opted to get some room service. This was very average and was very expensive for what we got. The service was ok and was of the level one would expect. I don't know why all the staff have earpieces in, a little over the top and there is an air of arrogance amongst some of the front desk staff which was evident to many people we spoke to. The room concept of warehouse redevelopment may have been trnedy when the hotel first opened but now it looks tired and weathered. It actually gives the feel of a cheap motel room. A pity considering the position of the hotel and potential it has. Would we stay here again (not on a Melbourne Cup day)? I just don't know.............

Reviews.Title: “A quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: jloPerth
Reviews.Content: We needed to find a hotel for a 1 night stopover on our way back to Perth. This hotel came up with comparable pricing to 4 star hotels, so I booked it and I am glad I did. We were welcomed by name on arrival which was impressive and all the staff were fantastic (especially the doorman when we were leaving for the airport the following day - Thank you for the umbrella and being so lovely!) The hotel is visually impressive and the bar area is very cool. Our room was so cute with the king sized bed & bathroom upstairs (great bath too!) and living area downstairs (loft style) Great finishes, super clean and comfortable. And I love the turndown service!!. The only downside was the noise levels travelling from pub accross the road which went into the early hours of the morning. It would be better to request a room away from this if you can. We had a drink in the bar area which was expensive ($18 for a glass of wine) and then went out to find somewhere for dinner. There are many beautiful restaurants along the wharf, however we choose to dine at Sienna Marina Restuartant & Bar directly accross the street from the hotel and we weren't dissapointed. I would actually recommend just heading over there as their drinks prices were half that in the hotel (and for great cocktails too!) The food was absolutely superb, the staff were friendly and the restaurant has super comfortable lounges and a fireplace which would have been perfect to relax by given it was 17 degrees and raining! The charge for the room was wrong on checkout ($50 more) however when I brought this to their attention, it was quickly rectified. I would definately stay here again - for longer next time :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frangipannitraveller
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay in the hotel, but was still great. Our first experience with this hotel was when we went to check-in, our booking wasn't listed, without any fuss the person at reception simply sorted it out and we were in our room. The duck down pillows were very nice. Water vew room was spacious and comfortable. Everything worked and no issues. We didn't eat at there but the Water Bar was very nice, has a sort of funky/exotic feel about it, cocktails were nice but around $18 each. There are a number of restaurants on the pier but will have to book on weekends otherwise will have to go elsewhere. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Laineylop
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of being a resident at Woolloomooloo Wharf many years ago when I worked in Sydney and vowed that on my return to the city I would stay at the W Hotel, now Blue Sydney. I stayed at Blue Sydney as part of my recent honeymoon in Australia and the experience was fantastic. Blue Sydney is located at Woolloomooloo Wharf and whilst not located in the CBD or at Circular Quay for me the location is amazing. The Wharf is about 10 minutes walk if you go through the Botanical Gardens or say 30-40 minutes if you choose the scenic walk via Boy Charlton Pool, Mrs Macquarieâ€™s Chair and of course the spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. That walk is so amazing and you never get bored of it! Woolloomooloo is a fun location to stay in when you are in Sydney. The hotel is near the legendary Harry's Cafe de Wheels (give the pies a miss, the Hot Dog de Wheels is the best) and the restaurants on the wharf are superb - people tend to rave about Otto and China Doll but I really love Aki's - if you love Indian food you really should go to Aki's. Blue Sydney is also near the lively areas of Darlinghurst and the slightly dodgier (bit still fun) King's Cross. On our honeymoon we went to China Doll and thought it was good value for money for the amazing food and great view. The Water Bar may no longer be the "it" place to go in Sydney - it seems to have lost some of its prestige compared to when I first lived in Sydney - but honestly we still though it the well mixed cocktails were great. Overall, I would so highly recommend Blue Sydney - it might not be in the CBD but with such a beautiful walk to the CBD and cheap taxis I think it is a fantastic choice if you are staying in Sydney. For us it was the only choice for our honeymoon. Thanks to the hotel for the free drinks we received as we were on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Sammytay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Blue for 4 nights in February and it was very comfortable - we had the room facing the marina which was quieter and the room size was very spacious and decked out with all the modern amenities. We travelled with a 1 year old and the room comfortably fit a cot in there. I knew that this hotel was formerly the W chain so i had expected the new management and branding to retain all the trimmings of the W hotel. The hotel was conveted from a former sea hauling fishing shed station so that added character and charm to the place. The hotel bar is quite nice although they have to shut by 1130pm to minimise noise as the hotel rooms are directly above surrounding the lobby and bar. The restaurants downstairs are also worth checking out. The location was nice and quiet by the marina but close enough for a short cab ride into town - the only issue with sydney is that by law all children under 8 require a proper baby car seat in the taxi so finding a taxi with one was very challenging, which made moving around a hassle. Being a 5 star hotel in sydney it wasnt cheap and the pricing reflected the quality of the hotel. But its something different from the typical 5 star hotel chains and more akin to the W chain of hotels (as it was previously)

Reviews.Title: “Smart and stylish warehouse”
Reviews.Author: mattp72
Reviews.Content: Lovely building (the largest single wooden structure in the southern hemisphere, apparently); stylish rooms, good location (fab gastropub The Tilbury is just round the corner and there are numerous posh restaurants on the wharf outside - very convenient). Downsides: the cavernous structure means the main hall (where the bar and breakfast area are) is chilly even in spring time and positively cold in winter - when I was there in July they had to put outdoor heaters by the breakfast tables. The low temperatures mean the bar is rarely busy which is a shame... and overall creates the effect of staying in a warehouse rather than a cosy hotel. Rooms have blinds rather than curtains which can be a problem for sleep quality. Having said all this, at current prices it's excellent value so I've been there twice this year and expect to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location....no taxis needed!!”
Reviews.Author: hennessy58
Reviews.Content: Amazing location within walking distance (2 mins) of Botanical Gardens, (6 mins) of Sydney Opera House, (2 mins) MCA and (8/10 mins) of main shopping area both general and designer stores i.e. Prada, Gucci, Bulgari etc. Hotel itself boutique style built within old shipping yard. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Four or five amazing restaurants located on quay side of hotel.....expensive but well worth it. Manta's sharing platter for two highly recommended. Only took taxi once to Bronte Beach and did coastal walk to Coogee Beach ....20/30 min walk but worth it for the views. Coogee Beach was recommended to us rather than famous Bondi Beach and we definitely were not disappointed!! Went in October which is their Springtime so would recommend light sweater/coat for evenings or occasional rain. DEFINITELY walking shoes/sneakers if you plan to walk like we did!! Found it on the expensive side!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly excellent”
Reviews.Author: mrdom
Reviews.Content: Great rooms - not usually much of a view but well appointed. Ones with loft bedrooms are particularly good. Bathrooms are excellent except that the water in the shower takes over 3 minutes to get hot. Seriously. I'd turn it on and go do something else. Very wasteful. Staff are excellent all round. Pool's nice but a bit of a walk. I only stay here when I get a cheap deal but note that they'll gouge you on any extras like parking, minibar, internet and food (the cafe's coffee is good but they charge $5! Plenty of quality cheaper coffee within 500m).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: GC75
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We arrived after a 24- hour flight slightly frazzled and immediately welcomed by friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean, bright and spacious and the restaurant is very good. Also a good location for the botanical gardens, the art gallery of NSW and the lovely Boy swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique Sydney experience”
Reviews.Author: worldtapestry
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we again had a comfortable and pleasant experience. The converted wharf makes for a very unique experince which gives you a feeling of being in Sydney compared to any boring familliar hotel around the world. Our loft room on level 5 looking towards Potts Point was much smaller than the one we had last time looking towards the city and I would definitely pay extra for those rooms next time. The loft has a very comfortable bed and bathroom but there was no room for our bags which means going up and down the stairs a lot. Given that there are not many of this type of room I wouldn't let it put you off. The restaurants and bar are great (at the expensive end but high quality) and if you're up for some long walks you can get to many other places, but this time as it was a quick stay we took taxis around to save time. If you only want to visit city attractions or take lots of ferrys then this isn't the closest hotel but is definitly more interesting. The room amenities are all excellent quality and the staff were attentive and friendly. We had no problems with noise and in fact we were surprised how quiet the bar was when we got back from our restaurant. I would go back or recommend it happily.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall hotel experience so far!”
Reviews.Author: camerartist
Reviews.Content: Over the years, whenever we're in Syd, we'd choose to stay within the CBD area. This time we decided to get away from it all and try somewhere else. The best move ever! Beautiful scenic location which is within 10 mins walk from the CBD. Friendly efficient staff wherever you turned. Nice and impressive loft studio, very clean and high quality amenities provided. We highly recommend this place and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pure excellence!!”
Reviews.Author: Laani
Reviews.Content: I have little negative things to say about the Blue Hotel. The things that I would fault are even at a complimentary basis. The room was beautifully kept and furnished. The staff were happy and helpful. Staying here made my partner and my anniversary even more special by leaving a card wishing us well on our special day, as well as offering complimentary wine to celebrate. However we were asked twice which type of wine we would prefer and when it was sent up, we found it was neither a white or sparkling, but a red. Unfortunately me or my partner do not drink red and although we were very thankful of the offer, we did not want for it to go to waste. After calling 24/7 and advising them of this, they sent up a bottle of sparkling!! It was without a doubt, one of the best experiences in service and overall at a hotel, I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Wilsonau
Reviews.Content: Good service, friendly and efficient staff. Noisy door doof music until midnight on a Friday night spoiled the experience.

Reviews.Title: “You just can't go wrong staying at this hotel...more than a hotel a great experience”
Reviews.Author: travellingma71
Reviews.Content: Fantastic...great for us, one family with an 8 year old and one family with a 2 year old. Room brilliant, service absolutely fantastic...really really great. Very friendly and super organised and efficient. It was my birthday and they went to some extra efforts which was great. We will be back again. Stayed on the Pott's Point side and always something to look at out the window...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, easy access to city/airport”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Blue for a business meeting. The hotel is set within an old wharf buildling, half of which is the hotel, the other half private apartments. The hotel has a wonderful sense of history and although it is clearly a luxury boutique Taj property, the building has not be changed visually. The ground floor has the Water bar and restaurant, the upper levels (think of an atrium style hotel inside) have the rooms and suites, which either look over the marina or the naval base. I was put into a marina view room and all the rooms are significantly larger than an ordinary hotel room. The bathroom was huge, separate shower to the bath (how nice is that), plenty of hanging space, tea/coffee, iron, decent hairdryer, WIFI access in the room $9 per 24 hours, yes per 24 hours or about $56 for a week. If you didn't bring a laptop, there are four computer stations on each floor which are available for guests. If you want to do printing, take a thumb drive and the reception will print off documents (for a small fee probably, I didn't try it). The bed was large and most importantly it was comfortable with a large pillow menu. The room was very clean, furnished sufficiently for two people and in muted colours. It isn't at all fussy or OTT like some hotels. I had some excellent tapas type dishes down in the Waterbar (www.waterbaratblue.com)washed down with a lovely cocktail. This bar has won many awards and justifiably so. I also tried room service and the prices were amazing ranging from $25 to $35 on average for excellent food, beautifully presented and delicious. This isn't really a hotel for families but it would definitely suit couples and corporates. It takes about 15 minutes from the airport to reach Woolloomooloo and about the same amount of time, depending on traffic, to walk into the heart of Sydney CBD. It would be an excellent place to meet up for business or leisure as there are at least 5 restaurants on the wharf for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Jodie M
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and location. Food was fantastic. Great staff. Loved the Bellinis at the bar. Can't wait to go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with expert staff.”
Reviews.Author: HighclereAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the weekend and this hotel could not have been any better. The rooms were lovely, clean and spacious. Ours had a loft which was great. We looked over the water, albeit near the roadway as the marina rooms were fully booked. The service was exceptional and the breakfast very good. I could not fault this hotel and we will definitely be back. We stayed on Saturday night and had a lovely cocktail in the bar. We did not have any noise disturbance from the bar. There were lots of lovely little touches that made it special.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: starbuck69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Hotel at the end of July 2011. The staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was amazingly clean and spacious and had a lovely view of the water. The restaurants nearby on the wharf were very good with a great range of options. We had breakfast at the hotel which was also good. Wooloomooloo is a lovely area of Sydney and in close proximity to the city making it very convenient. The only complaint we had was the very loud music that came from the bar area throughout the evening and night. It went on until very late/early morning. We stayed on a Saturday night so it was very busy, very loud and clearly very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but relaxed - a good choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Genny147
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Blue for a long weekend break in Sydney. The hotel is built on the old Docks storehouses, and integrates some of the old features in its design. It has a pleasant ambience and trendy atmosphere without being pretentious. We had one of the more basic rooms which had a skylight and only a high window but this was fine with us. Beds were very comfortable (they offer a choice of pillows but we were happy with the down ones provided). It was simply but attractively decorated, which we liked, though if you prefer something more opulent/traditional this is not for you. The view was outside whenever you wanted to go there. The setting couldn't be better. There are good views of Sydney Harbour and Wooloomoloo marina (there are more expensive rooms that have a choice of views) - it was also close to the Domain, the NSW Art Gallery, a scenic walk through the gardens to the Opera House, and Circular Quay and a short walk from the city, though if you don't or can't walk it is not as central as other hotels. Taxis are usually available outside, and we don't recommend walking up to and around Kings Cross after dark, especially on quieter nights. Our room was directly off the mezzanine area above the bars and restaurant - quiet for most of the time, but it may not be on busier weekends - we weren't there when the Friday night bar crowds assemble. Rooms further away from this area should be quieter. On the downside, the breakfast was expensive but very ordinary, and on one day we tried the Italian/Turkish cafe over the road which was just as good, friendlier and half the price. Parking is also ridiculously expensive as there is no parking in the hotel itself and the staff take your car away somewhere and bring it back when you check out. The hotel recommends some of the restaurants along the wharf. We tried their recommendation of 'China Doll' and found it excellent. This is a great place for a couples weekend, business or overseas visitors. It's not really designed for families or those who want a traditional style of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic discovery”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTraveller92
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently as part of a work trip. I'd heard great things from my partner and work colleagues who have stayed at the Blue, and this was my first experience. In short: Service - Amazing. A cut above the rest Breakfast - fantastic Location - Perfect. Away from the hustle/bustle of the city, but a stone's throw from everything. The restaurants on Cowper Street Wharf, and pubs nearby really leave you no reason to leave the area for entertainment. A morning stroll along the wharf looking at all the boats and properties was lovely! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Lukeandjamie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has me left a little disappointed. The service on arrival is the best you'll ever experience. However, don't expect a sea view or a view of the water. Both times I've stayed there it's been a road view. Walking into my room, it appeared it was only partially clean, the toilet almost made me sick with faeces on the outside of the bowl! No change of room when I complained but after the shock of checking in we did enjoy ourselves. Walking distance to the Opera House, into Sydney CBD and to Oxford Street, it's location is great as it feels like your in the suburbs. However, there are so many hotels that are better, cleaner and in great locations. Unfortunately I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Attend to my every need”
Reviews.Author: mtpearl
Reviews.Content: I work in sydney often and i always choose the Blue. Its a small boutique hotel with 5 star touch. This is the best hotel in the eastern suburbs of sydney. It is on the water and close to the botanical gardens, Boy Charlton pool and some good restaurants or pubs. Usually they ensure i receive the same room. Checkin/out is fast and the valet is efficient. The breakfast is healthy and fresh. The building is amazing - its an old wool warehouse/depot and oozes history The only criticism is that there can be functions in the foyer some evenings, but they rarely go later than 10.30pm, (The noise can be heard in the room.) and management do their best to inform you and minimise disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “It's quirky, I enjoyed it, but it's not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: SarahIzzy
Reviews.Content: If you have a thing for artsy lofts or warehouses turned into apartments, then this hotel is for you! It's on the water, close to good restaurants, and walking distance to the shops and some museums. It's a great location for morning jogs! The staff are helpful, the rooms well-appointed in an aloof, minimalist way (with lots of the color blue) and the common areas are conversation starters if nothing else. Some of the meeting rooms or guestrooms aren't the most sound proof (perhaps stay away from rooms overlooking the atrium if you don't like noise). As with many upper market hotels, the internet is steep and the in house meals aren't exactly equal to the price paid, but still what you get is quite good value. I'll be staying again, although I must admit I like renovated old warehouses.

Reviews.Title: “A little isolated but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the heart of town but that may be a good thing. The room are spacious (had a 2 level suite on the 5th floor). Great breakfast buffet, nice attentive staff. It felt a little empty which is disappointing because it is a great hotel. The run from the hotel to the Bridge via the Opera is amazing (about 7K return).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing First Class Hotel! Had an A+++ visit and very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Hellothere036
Reviews.Content: Amazing first class hotel! If you haven't stayed in this part of Sydney, it is certainly worth doing so. For a girls night out, we stayed during the June long weekend. The location is very convenient and close to the CBD and Kings Cross (by taxi), though quiet and poses as a mini escape from the hustle and bustle. Service was A+++, valet parking and all. Interiors ultra stylish and awe-inspiring. Rooms and decor very tasteful and beds super comfortable, like you're sleeping on a cloud. They really have thought of everything to offer in the rooms. Bathroom is a visual treat and so are the views. If you want good coffee and an affordable brunch, Sienna Marina is just across the road. One of the most stunning and magnificent hotels in Sydney - don't hesitate BOOK NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky interesting hotel, but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: 3littlepigsgotroppo
Reviews.Content: Blue hotel is in a wonderful quirky building which has retained all the great architectural features of the wharf it once was. Son and I stayed on a Saturday night, we were fortunate enough to have been allocated a room on the 4th floor which appears to be the only floor with a wall buffering the rooms from the noisy atrium, even then the bass sounds of the music could be clearly heard in our room. We had a Deluxe Double room with 2 small double beds, a very spacious room with a lovely big bathroom and huge tub. Very clean, plenty of towels and housekeeping replaced all used toiletries/ tea/ coffee etc at turndown. Staff were smiley but unhelpful, the concierge staff could see our party arrive in a taxi but only took any interest once bags had been halled into the foyer, and gave scant directions on walking to Circular Quay, lucky we are Sydneysiders and could get our bearings once we got to the Art Gallery. The front desk staff did the minimum they had to with a smile. Our booking was paid in advance by a promotions company and included Valet Parking, when asked if it was possible to credit the unused valet parking credit towards breakfast we were greeted with a "No", not a I will ask the manager or even I will look on the computer to see what has been paid...just a no. At least they could have gone through the motions of checking what was on our account. So, this is a nice hotel, but other than the architectural value it is no nicer than plenty of other Sydney hotels and the location is rather inconvenient for city siteseeing. ( I wouldn't want to walk up and down the 105 stairs to the Domain too often!) The ordinary service and noise factor mean I would choose elswhere for my next city break. Over the past couple of years we have stayed at the Sydney Hilton, Sheraton on the Park, Sofitel Wentworth (twice), Crowne Plaza Darling Harbour and the Marque Hotel in Sydney. I would rank the Blue hotel above the Marque Hotel but below all the others in terms of overall visitor appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it ( mostly)”
Reviews.Author: Flyingstars
Reviews.Content: Initially loved the hotel - unique architecture that has incorporated the features of a heritage building into design. A great location especially if you don't mind a walk. Blue misses out on top rating due to a function and live concert on the 25th May that was so loud we could feel the vibrations in our room on the 3rd floor. We were advised the bar would be closed for a function - however we weren't advised that it would be necessary to vacate our room to get away from the noise. ( we had planned to stay in and get room service)... rang front desk to complain - no answer ( they probably couldn't hear the phone) rang the concierge - answered and hung up without speaking - no sympathy from front desk on way out... Check before booking if they have a function planned!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place- Loud At Night”
Reviews.Author: KevinLisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the end of our Australian adventure. Cool location, unique hotel, two story loft rooms... all quite 'hip'. Breakfast was not included in our rate so we did not get to try their buffet nor did we try any of the restaurants that surround the hotel on the wharf. As mentioned in previous reviews all the rooms surround the bar so the music can be a bit disturbing at night. All in all I would say give it a go due to it's unique style and location.

Reviews.Title: “Pay $400 to stay in a nightclub”
Reviews.Author: SimonMcCrudden
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of good things to say about blue - the staff are friendly, the rooms are a good size and well equipped. But I'm writing this whilst trying to get my son back to sleep after being woken uo by a live concert being performed in the atrium downstairs. The noise is deafening. We were given no warning when booking this suite that this 'event' would be happening. And we were told by staff on the night that it would be over by 730. I have just spoken to a manager and when I said to him that if we had been told this would be happening that we wouldnt have booked here, and that I suspected many other guests wouldn't, he just said 'I agree'. He has offered nothing by way of compensation even when I gave him the opportunity. He even said there was no point moving rooms because it would be as loud everywhere. You pay good money to relax. This is a good hotel. But I will never stay here again. They have their priorities wrong - guests should come first, not so called private parties that can be loudly heard in every room in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR A FOODIE WEEKEND!”
Reviews.Author: delndan
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, received a room upgrade from our Queen Rafter Room. Upgrade faced the waterfront, although lacked any of the historic and loftlike features of the images. Otherwise, was very well fitted out and serviced. Although facing the hustle and bustle of the pier, there wasn't any noticeable noise in the room. There was a very musty mould smell which we couldn't place, but it seemed to be coming from the Robe.. Given we were hardly in the room , this didn't prove to be a problem. Service was always efficient and professional...Amazing location, don't miss CHINA DOLL restuarant below the hotel - great food, great value and great service. Although we didn't travel for business, I cannot beleive how much Australian hotels are charging for internet usage - when are we going to cathc up with the rest of the world and provide free wifi?????

Reviews.Title: “Forgetful service pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: dublindu0
Reviews.Content: Ok if in an odd place - need to allow a long walk through a difficult area or always take a cab. Stylish chic with somewhat forgetful service. Veiw?

Reviews.Title: “Uber chic...”
Reviews.Author: thewattos
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a hotel! From the personal greetings from the concierge staff to the rooms, everything is ultra-professional and very cool. Rooms are fantastic (except for the price of the water.. $8? C'mon!!) Wonderfully located to the city (particularly the Art Gallery and botanic garden walk to Circular Quay, this is a real hotel to spoil yourself. Worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: girlsinging
Reviews.Content: The first thing I said when we walked into Blue was, 'we are SO not cool enough to stay here' ... !! It's stunning. From the ultra-hip bar to the gorgeous decor, glass elevators, ambient lighting, professional staff, lovely rooms ... and the list goes on ... our four-night stay was superb. It was a special holiday for us, the week after our wedding, and we were given a complimentary upgrade to a marina-view loft suite. We would have been happy with a naval base view (which is what we had booked), but wow, we were thrilled with the upgrade. Even more thrilled when a congratulatory bottle of Moet champagne and a handwritten note turned up after we arrived at our room. Stunning views, quiet room, beautifully furnished. The service was excellent (they even serviced our room while we were out for dinner one night - we came home to find Lindt chocolates on the bed and slippers waiting for us), the hotel was quiet, and we absolutely loved being there. We had no car and no need for internet or room service meals, so no complaints about what things cost. We had late-night drinks and tapas in the bar one night and the bill was reasonable for a 5-star venue ... the food was sensational, and the service fantastic. It took us about 20 mins on a hot day to walk over the hill through the botanical gardens to Circular Quay, and around $10 for a taxi home. The split level loft suites have small bathrooms with very little storage space for toiletries etc. The downstairs toilet is also small. This didn't worry us much but we could see how it might irritate some guests. It's also important to note that some of the rooms at Blue have no windows - just skylights - so be careful when you book. The restaurants along the pier under the hotel are beautiful but expensive. We ate at the lovely (and MUCH cheaper) Italian restaurant over the road (pizza, pasta and great cheap breakfasts!), and at Circular Quay and the Rocks. Overall we were thrilled with our stay. Everything was beautiful, the apartment was gorgeous, the bed was comfortable, the staff were friendly, and we had a lovely, romantic escape for four days. We sincerely hope to return to Blue - even though a bigger bathroom would have been great, it was honestly the best place we've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Read the details and select rooms carefully.”
Reviews.Author: 255100Paul
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel with Blue Theme. Converted Passenger Terminus. Unique and recommended for couples. Walking to Opera House and CBD about 15 minutes. Was advised to book a Loft Suite room on 5th floor for family. Very small for 4 guests. Sofa bed used for 2 teenagers. Bathroom tiny.These rooms are adequate for couples. DO NOT book a room on the naval base side unless price is an issue. No views, close to road with noise. I specifically asked for a room away from the road hoping for better views. This request was not acknowledged on arrival. Essentially the naval side aspect is ugly. A internet deal stay 4 nights and pay for 3 was not honoured and the error had to be addressed. There are no facilities for heating food and the kettle is hidden in closet. Enjoyed the Pool. The centre of the hotel is caverness and has a trendy bar. Breakfast facilities. Upmarket and sophisticated. The restaurants along the broadwalk are also high class but empty during the week. But the ambience is great. The Hotel is visually isolated from the CBD so the restaurants would rely on recommendations rather than passing trade. Across the road is a relaxed breakfast cafe (Charlie's). Sunny with outdoor eating option. Also an Italian Restaurant on corner with great Pizzas and Pasta. Valet Parking @ $ 50 a day, a rip off. I used underground parking $90 per week !!! in Domain Carpark. In & out anytime until 10.00 pm and then car agists overnight!!! Cannot arrange this on Internet. The Carpark attendants facilitate the weekly ticket. 5 minute walk from Hotel using a pedestrian bridge. The Domain Carpark has a 500 metre travelator to the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: austraveller123_11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to have a quiet night by myself to relax. I booked one of their cheaper rooms but recieved a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful Loft Suite which had a lovely view of the city and water. All the staff were so friendly and accomodating and unlike other 5 star hotels it was a relaxed atmosphere where they had time to have a chat with you. From check in until check out I had a wonderful experience and will definately be going there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Blue Sydney. The Wolloomooloo location is unique and we thought excellent - away from the CBD but walking distance to it and most other Sydney attractions. The Opera House, Circular Quay, bridge and CBD are a 10-15 minute walk through the botanical gardens, which are gorgeous. Plenty of excellent dining choices in the immediate area including casual cafes and a variety of upmarket restaurants on the wharf itself. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and quiet , although the bathroom was a bit small in our suite. The only complaint I have about the rooms is that they smell a bit stale, largely because you can't open the windows in the rooms. This is a design flaw that I think is a mistake, particularly in a beautiful city in a hotel with wonderful weather and views. The front desk personnel and concierges deserve special mention. They were exceptionally helpful to us during the entirety of our stay. I would recommend the hotel and return again.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney hot spot”
Reviews.Author: US-Lux
Reviews.Content: II have stayed at the Blue twice and will be back. The neighbourhood, Woolloomooloo, heas been rehabilitated over the past years and this hip & cool hotel is in an impressive former warehouse, also hosting luxury condos with a fitness & pool open for use to hotel guests. Rooms are very nice, the bedding is perfect, bathrooms are quite spacious and practical, service is caring and attentive. Some of Sydney's best restaurants are just downstairs, off the pier. Great location to go sightseeing, a quick walk to the centre through the Royal Botanical Gardens, and a 15 minutes walk to the hot Oxford Street and its clubs (avoid walking through the area at night though). Sometimes trendy hotels greet you with a lot of attitude, but nothing like this at the Blue. It is surely one of the best options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service - Stayed here night before my wedding”
Reviews.Author: Corinne_N_114
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! such a great atmosphere, the decor and style is done so beautifully, very modern/ historical twist. I stayed here for the night before my wedding and they helped me so much! They bent the late checkout rules for me so I could stay until 1pm, I also recieved a complimentary bottle of champagne, and they were very helpful with assisting my makeup artist and Hair dressers with their car and moving their equipment up to my room. I stayed in the Pier loft room. Rooms were large,good light, great views, they were also quiet and had an amazing bed in there! I love their pillows they are so comfortable. I also like how they do the loft style rooms, so funky! Thank you Blue for your beautiful service, and making my special day run smoothly! I will never forget it. I cant wait to stay here again! looking for an excuse to stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel - just don't ever make a phone call- disappointing policies and customer service”
Reviews.Author: curiousqueries
Reviews.Content: This is a second trip to Blue Sydney - we had loved the location close to the botanical gardens, kings cross and most things were within a 10 to 15 minute walk. The restaurants on the wharf had been super cool the last time but had gotten very pricey and pretentious at this last visit. Nearby across the street are a few local bar/restaurants which are not the best but are adequate if you are too tired to make the 15 minute walk to kings cross. The rooms are fine but don't bother upgrading to the wharf room and paying more as all we got was a big view of the shell gas station really and in sydney one does not spend anytime looking out the window anyways or staying in the hotel! the hotel staff are not the most friendly and the environment is cold and snooty. I looked at hotel policies and the book and also asked the concierge, the hotel reception and also called the 24 hour hotline who all reassured me that local calls were one dollar. I called my friend in Sydney locally three times lasting less than 1-3 minutes and they charged me 107 AUD dollars! I was very upset but apparently, her phone was a mobile and not a landline and therefore they could justify charging this at checkout and stated that this was posted in the hotel book but I saw this nowhere and had checked three times, three separate people. This ruined my vacation and the polices are terrible. I will never stay here again and I go to sydney frequently, nor will i ever stay in a taj hotel. What a rip off and poorly advertised policy. If I had known and had not been mislead, I would have gotten internet and skyped for 10 cents the three phone calls. A terrible experience and not worth the almost 1000 dollars I paid to stay three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lizard7275
Reviews.Content: The place is just visiting to watch the building, the rooms are spacious, elegant and comfortable. The location is fantastic, great Sydney view, by the water and very good restaurants right on the ground floor. Good service too. Only room for improvement: the smell in the hall and breakfast area due to the algae in the water -the hotel is on a dock. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: This Hotel under W or Blue doesnt make much of a difference under the different banners. I've stayed numerous times under both and if anything, it is much better under Blue. It remains to be one of my favourite Hotels of all time and thats saying something about it because my standards are ridiculously high but I tell it like it is. I love the loft style and the comfort of the couch fabrics. The bed was all so comfy and could have slept in it all day. TV's are now LCD's in both upstairs and down. Bathrooms were on the smaller side but no complaints. Just everything about the hotel was cool with the lighting, the historic boatshed feel, to the lobby and bar. Tho the restaurant set up was very unique where you sat in the middle of the wharf. The only thing negative about the hotel is the location is "too close yet too far". It's located just outside the CBD but it is a fair walk through the gardens etc to get out. Other than that, great place!

Reviews.Title: “Character plus”
Reviews.Author: jeremythorpe
Reviews.Content: The converted pier makes a stunning hotel. My king room was large, but quite hot. I forgot my laptop charger, and was disappointed that they could not loan me one.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: traveller1234_6
Reviews.Content: We booked the Blue Hotel, Sydney for a stay over New Year 2010/11, we expected to be in one of the rooms over-looking the road but we had a Wharf view room which was absolutely amazing! All of the staff at the hotel were very attentive and friendly, without being overly intrusive. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, perfect location - close enough to the centre of Sydney but away from all of the hustle and bustle of city life, we found it the perfect base to explore an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Blue @ Woolloomooloo is excellent”
Reviews.Author: PennyDitchfield
Reviews.Content: Great location and very accessible to the city - about a 10min walk . The service was very good and staff were very friendly - we were particularly impressed. The room was really nice - the bed was particularly comfy. Breakfast was great. Lots of really good restaurants nearby. The wharf itself is a great historical structure and well worth having a good look around. If you're looking for a great weekend in Sydney can really recommend Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, steeped in history”
Reviews.Author: Vada
Reviews.Content: As others have correctly pointed out the Blue Hotel is situated in the old Fingerwharf, which for Australians is a significent piece of our history being the embarking place for the AIF troops leaving for Egypt and eventually Gallipoli 1914 -15. And the disembarking place for our soldier/survivors returning from Changi. The hotel only makes up for a portion of this extensive building and the rooms surround, on a couple of different levels, what apparently is a nightclub/function room. A previous poster indicated that they experienced really bad noise levels arising from from this area which was being used as a nightclub during a weekend. We approached this information with some apprehension as we were staying on a Saturday night. On leaving the hotel about 7pm a crowd was gathering, we made some inquiries and learnt that it was a private function. On returning to the hotel about midnight from the movies, the crowd was dispersing and caused no noise problems. ** It would certainly be worthwhile for intending weekend visitors to check before making booking. Overall the hotel is in a great location, surrounded by restaurants and the iconic " Harry's Cafe de Wheels" is 100 metres down the street. The view from the room, overlooking Garden Island and the Navy ships at anchor, was pleasant. The A/C on a particulary hot/humid weekend was efficent. Bathroom large and everything working ok. Check in/out was flawless as was the attention to detail, options of turning down beds, newspapers, valet service etc. It would be fair to say that we have in recent years travelled extensively in Europe, South America and always had the option of FREE Wi Fi available in even the smallest pensions, being asked to pay $AUD 7.00 per hour in a hotel that is quite expensive by any standard is really "excessive gouging". In summary it is a good hotel, a little soul -less, mainly because of the unique structure of the building. Would we return? Probably not, there are so many alternatives available in close proximity, less expensive and without the "gouging"

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and in need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: JenniferMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here some years ago when it was called Hotel W. It was amazing when it was new however, it feels like nothing has been replaced or upgraded since then. The rooms are tired and although they don't actually look dirty the general feel is that the place needs a good wash and airing out. We had to produce photo I.D. along with the credit card when checking in... the drivers licence was then photocopied which we felt a bit of a security issue in these days of identity theft, however there was no option. Check in staff were not friendly when asked about it and said it was to check that the credit card supplied belonged to the person presenting it. we stay in many hotels around Australia and around the world it was a most unpleasent check in experience...not a good start to the stay. It did get better however, we had a function in house that night. The food served was great and waitstaff professional. We only had a continental breakfast the next morning and would not recommened it.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE Blue!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Lovell
Reviews.Content: We are from Melbourne and choose the Blue Hotel when we visit Sydney, mainly due to the amazing bar and funky rooms. There is nothing like this in Sydney, or even in Australia. The location is brilliant, an easy 15-20 minute walk to the city center yet the hotel feels as if it is in fact nowhere near the city center which is great for a relaxing weekend getaway from all the hustle and bustle. The main bar is the feature here and continues on from when the hotel was the W. One of the standout bars in the country, with a premium selection of drinks and cocktails that are hard to find anywhere. It's pricey, but for the attention and service we receive each and every time we visit it is well worth it.
