We highly recommend the Blue Hotel to anyone looking for something slightly different, ultra cool and ultra stylish.

Reviews.Title: “It's not as good as it used to be.....”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: The Blue Hotel used to be amazing 2-3 years ago. Unfortunately now the rooms are tired. The service levels have really dropped away. The prices are ridiculous. We stayed at the Blue on our honeymoon. The whole experience was just very disappointing.....

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret - world class!!”
Reviews.Author: seznang
Reviews.Content: For the discerning guest. If you know what to look for and expect the best, this place leaves all other major 5 star hotels in sydney for dead. A refreshing new approach to good old fashioned attentive service with all the new mod cons you need. Steve concierge knows exactly what you need to make an exjoyable memorable stay. My partner arranged a night stay for our anniversary recently and we were blown away !! From start to finish we were catered for, our every request was met with prompt, polished and friendly service. We have travelled around the world and this place stands out by far. Well worth and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and view, expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: mnonthego
Reviews.Content: After a long international flight, we were delighted to have chosen such a nice hotel to relax and rest for a few days. We were put in room 327; the room was great with a beautiful view on the pier. We liked: Stylish, large room Very beautiful setting Fantastic bar We did not like: Expensive extras such as internet access(25$/day) and a 2-minute local mobile call that was charged 14$.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Made our stay!”
Reviews.Author: bpw4
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Australia and booked this purely from the reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed. The location made our stay situated, as it iis, on the wharf. Hop, skip and a jump to the Domain and Botanical gardens and fabulous views of Opera House and Bridge on the walk to Circular Quay.. We stayed in a Pier Room and had a great view. Rooms including bathroom very spacious and turn down service perfect after a busy day sight-seeing Staff were absolutely brilliant . Cleaning staff in particular were extremely courteous and efficient. Also special mention to Maryam who was warm and friendly as well as being extremely courteous and welcoming. As mentioned in earlier revoews Sydney is horrendously expensive - think of a figure and multiply by 3 - this must be the most expensive city in the world? Internet is ridiculously priced with only onefree terminal in reception. I would thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting Sydney

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel with a few little flaws”
Reviews.Author: nordischboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really great located, the treatment guests receive by the staff was also great and the first view of the room and bathroom was amazing. Throughout our stay at the hotel though we experienced a few flaws. Internet is not for free - $10/hour or $25/day. When you pay so much for a stay it should be included. The bathroom could use some work with the ceiling needing a new paint on a couple of spots. Another point, the Hotel Bar (Water Bar) is open for the public and on weekends (especially Fridays and Saturdays) you can here the bass of the music in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel that provides a great experience, just a little bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: MitchLions
Reviews.Content: Blue is a beautiful hotel, converted from a harbour warehouse in Woolloomoolloo. The inside of the building is stunning, the warehouse structure means that the centre has been left largely empty, making it light, spacious and airy. The rooms are equally stylish and boutiquey in design, but beware the cheapest rooms, thet have skylights instead of windows. Blue is a little off the beaten track, and the local bars and restaurants are nothing special. Even the hotel bar itself, while achingly cool, is a little quiet and soulless. However its only a 15 minute walk into town, once you figure out the short cuts. If the hotel itself is the most important factor, and you're willing to drive or take taxis around, Blue could well be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Trying too hard to be cool”
Reviews.Author: amm1u
Reviews.Content: No real complaints about the quality of the BLUE, but it is over-priced and puts too much emphasis on style over substance. Certainly it's an impressive makeover of an interesting old building (previously a dockside warehouse) and is nicely fitted out, but you get the impression you're paying over the odds for the privilege of being trendy. Some irritating examples include the Waterbar, which is lit so darkly that it's impossible to read the drinks menu and has electro-pop music pounding constantly day and night. It's more like a night club than a place to have a relaxing evening drink, with prices to match and on the evening I was there, didn't even have a proper stock of drinks available. Pluses are the luxurious bedrooms and the friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is very good, but again, very expensive - $19.50 for continental; internet access is also ludicrously expensive . I found the location ideal, as it's only 15 minutes easy walk to Circular Quay or the Kings Cross neighbourhood and there are some bars/restaurants nearby. It's also only 30-35 minutes walk from the SCG and don't listen to the advice to try and get there by public transport, which is longer and much more complicated. A word of warning to Sydney first-timers is that it must surely now be one of the most expensive cities in the world, so top up your credit card limit before coming!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, and you don't have to stay in the City!”
Reviews.Author: Avonleanz
Reviews.Content: When this hotel came up in the list of corporate hotels, I was a bit concerned about the Woolloomooloo location, but after reading a number of positive reviews on TripAdvisor, I took the plunge. I don't like staying in the centre of Sydney as it's too noisy, and my other option was North Ryde.. enough said.. Well.. the location is brilliant!! There is all forms of transport available from the door, as well as a very relaxing walk through the Botanic Gardens to or from the City Centre. King's Cross is also a nice walk in the other direction. The staff are extremely efficient, from the "radio miked" doormen to the "radio miked" desk staff, and back to the doorman who showed me around the room I was in. The room was palatial with a full bathroom with separate bath and shower. It was quiet and the beds were quite comfortable, so sleep was not an issue. My only gripe, if I have to write one? Internet access is quite expensive. I would have hoped for it to be included in the room rate, but it wasn't. Almost the cost of a month's wireless, so pack your USB stick. All-up, and excellent hotel and well worth a move from the city to the bay!

Reviews.Title: “My preferred hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times now and again really enjoyed the hotel during Nov 2010. I had looked at other less expensive hotels but ended up booking the Blue due to it location - as I was traveling down from North NSW, visiting friends in Sydney and then headed to the airport the next morning. The Blue was a great choice as it is quiet, elegant and very easy to get to and then to the airport. Good room service and finally I managed to use the gym. The gym is small but had good equipment and the pool looked v nice. It is inside but given it was raining there no chance of sun anyway. Happy to report there is now a spa open in the complex (Adsul) and the service was great. Full spa and hair at v reasonable prices. I think that the spa ambiance was even better than what it was when Spa Chakra operated on the site. Great choice when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I paid for the view and I kept staring out of my window for hours”
Reviews.Author: sadikhov
Reviews.Content: Before I booked this hotel for my wedding night, I came in twice to explore if it was suitable enough for my fiance and myself. The staff was so polite to show me the rooms and options that I could possibly take. "Hugo" and other staff members, whose names i do not remember, explained me all the cons and pros of the rooms and dedicated quite enough time for it. They were really helpful and I felt that they care. I knew that if something goes wrong during my wedding day, the service will be there for us. And it was. Finally I booked marina king room for two nights (costed me around $340/day) for my wedding night in the end of October. My fiance (wife now) and I moved in there a night before the wedding night. The hotel staff was incredibly polite and nice to us. They kept repeating "whatever you need, just press that button on the phone, remember - whatever you need, and we'll be there for you". First night we ordered in-room movie, but it started glitching in the middle of watching. We called the reception, and they said that it's a technical problem and that they will not charge us for it. They really did not. Bathrooms are huge, plenty of space to walk in, nice bathtub and shower cabin. The view out of the king marina room was incredible! I was staring in the window all morning and evening watching boats and fishermans on the wharf. The hotel located near the botanic gardens - my another most favourite place in Sydney. For tourists visiting Sydney it is a "must visit" place. We had a number of wedding visitors, such as hairdresser, florist, photographer, bridal party, all coming to the hotel, and reception would call us to inform about their arrival and letting them in upstairs. No hastle at all. From the negative side, i think the hotel is too expensive for what it offers. We ordered a piece of cake to the room for kids, and they charged $20 for it. Bottled water is not free in the room, it was something around $9-$11. No free internet, in fact it was so expensive, I did not even bother using it. There is no free parking around. Hotel charges $40 for valet parking, but I must admit, it is a convenient option if you do not stay there for too long. On one ocasion, they brought someone's car instead of ours, so we had to wait a bit longer in the lobby. We did not have time to dine in the restaurants and cafes downstairs, but heard that they are too pricey as well. Well I think for the location like that they should be, just like everywhere in Sydney. There was some noticeable dust layer on the bottles in the minibar. Possibly guests might not even touched it for months because of high in-room prices. The furniture in the lobby looks a bit worn out. The checkout is very early - 10am, however when we asked for a late checkout, we were allowed to stay till 11am. Service wise, I have never experienced a better service and staff's professionalism in any of the hotels I stayed in my life, and I stayed in many hotels in many different countries. Overall my wife and I were both happy of our stay in BLUE Taj and I was confident that I did a good choice for a wedding night!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well appointed rooms, centrally located, but oh so quiet”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: You will enjoy the Blue from your first step. It is a 5 star hotel with a difference - the architecture of the modern rooms built around the existing wharf features, and the rooms themselves. All the comforts of 5 stars but a hotel where you will enjoy taking in your surrounds as you walk to your room. As well as being stylish, the design is very clever to minimise the noise from within and outside the hotel. We could not believe how quiet it was inside the room. Everything has been well thought out, from the incredibly comfortable bedding, right down to the dual blinds so you can get a great sleep here at any time. We stayed in a King Pier view room and it was a lovely, large room. The pool, spa and gym have everything you need for a short stay but is a bit of a trek from the hotel. The few downsides - the cafe in the Blue is overpriced and underwhelming. The reception service was a bit hit and miss. Our paper was forgotten one morning. We got a turndown service 2 nights out of 4. The doormen were not always present. You can walk to almost anywhere you would want to go in central Sydney from the Blue. Don't feel limited by the cafes and restaurants you can see from the hotel itself. There are great places nearby in Potts Point, East Sydney, Darlinghurst and Surrey Hills. Strongly recommend you go to the Boy Charlton pool cafe for breakfast (a lovely 10 minutes walk from the Blue - as the concierge for directions).

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel stay we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_J_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Hotel last Friday and Saturday night as a special weekend getaway from Melbourne. Our friends advised us that we should stay at this hotel, and they weren't wrong. This place is a true gem, verging on amazing. Great places have the ability to completely transform you away from everyday life into a fantasy world that one can only dream of. Everything from the welcome we recieved from the concierge team to the incredicle detail in each room was senseational. Even the gracious service we recieved in the bar was more than first class. The breakfast was on the expensive side, but well woth it. The food was delicious and plenty of it. I simply cannot fault anything about the Blue Hotel at all, and that's rare, wherever you go. We will definitely be back next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Great Location and The Service that you want”
Reviews.Author: Hamed1980
Reviews.Content: Loved the 2 floor "junior suite". The service was great. Location was Very good. Only 15 min walk to Opera House. If u like seafood and if u like indian food then u have got to eat at the indian restaurant next door. Try the dish with lobster and you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation - but no personal touch”
Reviews.Author: miffymoo
Reviews.Content: I live locally and decided to use Blue as the hotel my family would stay in the night before my wedding. My husband and I then spent our wedding night at Blue before heading off overseas. Overall I was impressed, the hotel room was beautiful and the bathroom actually quite stunning (except for the water saving shower head, this is supposed to be a 5 star hotel). However, I found the service was not quite personal enough. It did not feel as though anybody knew we were there and a certain warmth was lacking (it was almost too easy to slip in and out of the hotel without being noticed.) This includes leaving for and returning from my wedding ceremony! Nobody from Blue helped me into the car or even nodded in my direction, my sister was left out front for 20 minutes desperately trying to flag down a taxi, something that the Blue staff seemingly could not achieve... it was just a bit weird I guess, I was nervous enough heading off to my wedding ceremony and thought helping my (small) family with the taxi situation would be part of Blue's job. On our wedding night the music coming from the bar downstairs was really pumping until midnight, and the bar was next to empty. I know this is a common concern for many guests of Blue and think it's almost time for management to look at the bigger picture. I'm not sure the super loud music is going to attract anybody extra to the venue, and if anything it inspires guests to 'rethink' any return trip, especially with so many good accommodation deals available in Sydney. I suppose what I am trying to say is I really enjoyed Blue, but could have enjoyed it a whole lot more if they had simply reached out and given our stay a bit of a personal touch. I don't mean a discount or upgrade, a simple note or 'best of luck with the wedding, thanks for letting us be part of this' really would have added to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: Mary1965b
Reviews.Content: Beautifully located by the Botanical Gardens, this hotel is one of our favourites city hotels (it used to be a W). The split level rooms are fabulous, the staff are so friendly and nothing is ever too much, and the beds are so comfortable, we always sleep so well. Very decent size rooms, and gorgeous products in the bathrooms.The pool area is small and doesn't get a lot of sun, so it's not a destination if you are wanting to spend days by a hotel pool.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Fault This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joecas20
Reviews.Content: We arrived in sydney early friday morning to a seemless check in @ the Blue hotel in Woolloomooloo. From the moment we arrived we were kindly greated and Mark @ Check-in was fantastic. The service in this hotel throughout our whole weekedend in sydney was spot on and cannot be faulted. Each time we requested something it arrived in out Loft with in 15min. We booked a Marina Loft, This spilt level apartment was amazning, great views the room was fantastic ( the bathroom could be bigger, in saying this the double shower was a bouns) We recieved comp drink cards to be used at Water Bar, which is a great sydney night spot in its self, with heaps of great DJ's playing there every saturday night. We could choose any cocktail on this list which was fantastic. The house keep staff was friendly and very kind to us, and couldn not have been more helpfull. An added bouns in our Hotel Stay. The location is spot on the money, City in 5 min by Taxi or 10min, Oxford Street Paddington is 10min by Taxi and Bondi is a hop skip and jump away! All and all i rate my experience a 10 out of 10 for this hotel. I look forward to our next trip at the Blue Sydney. They only thing i could say an area to improve on is to offer Complimentary Breakfreast in all packages.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, stylish hotel in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru71
Reviews.Content: The Blue Sydney is a stylish hotel, with excellent rooms and great staff. There are several restaurants and cafes outside the hotel offering a range of cuisine, and it is a lovely walk from the hotel through the botanical gardens to Opera House and Sydney Harbour. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyTravelNow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Service provided by all staff was excellent. One of the most friendliest greetings from front of house staff we have ever experienced. We had a loft room which was clean and well presented. Bathroom was small. Difficult to have suitcase in bedroom as lack of space. Restaurants at the wharf were very good. Breakfast staff at the hotel were very attentive. Noise could be heard from function at the hotel bar below. Management apologised and said it occurs only a few times a year. Overall a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location & Room - Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Rooms are actually great, but in the middle of Winter the heating would not go off and it was like a sauna, we complained twice, they said they fixed it, but it was never fixed. The Breakfast was fine but the service terrible, cold tea, with the staff totally indifferent to us, They seemed to have an arrogant attiude and we the customer were inconveniencing them. Better Value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An experience to remember”
Reviews.Author: Subid
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney - Blue hotel on 10th and 11th of June 2010. The hotel is on a warf and a old ware house has been turned to a hotel - an architectural wonder. The room was a duplex suit with a living room (complete with TV, DVD player,Mini bar, wardrobe, and a large sofa which could be converted to a twin bed and a small toillette) on the lower level. the upper level was a bedroom with another TV , bath wardrobe et.all. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The restaurants well located and one being in the open facing a small cove. The location of the hotel was also very convenient and you could actually walk to the Botanical gardens, the opera house and the Harbour Bridge. It was a great experience for us and will cherish memories of the Blue hotel

Reviews.Title: “amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: gmanAuckland
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights last week and had a great time.....very friendly professional staff,with knowledge of the area. the location was great....close to shopping,great walks around the coastline to the opera house and botanical gardens,and very nice restaurants underneath

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: JKF13
Reviews.Content: I travel to sydney fortnightly and I'm on the hunt for a new hotel after stay at the Sir Stamford Circular Quay for years. I stay at the Langham in Melbourne and usually love Leading Hotels of the World but not the Blue. I'm totally gobsmacked that this is an lhw member. Based on my 5 stays I definitely won't be using the Blue as my Sydney digs. The rooms are all different shapes and sizes and what you paid for last time can be totally different the next. The room inconsistency is matched by the service inconsistency, and the staff wreek of Sydney "I'm too cool". Get over yourself Blue, you're a very very average establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: Travelux7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue for one Saturday night. The location is great for the Woolloomooloo Wharf restaurants. It's really easy to catch a cab and the concierge staff will help you flag one down. The rooms were OK- I gfound them small and pokey. The bathroom was tiny- we stayed ina marina suite so we ahd two levels but the it still felt small. The chocolates in the mini bar were two months past their sell by date- disappointing when you have sugar craving! The breakfast in tghe Blue cafe was very disappointing. The service was great but the food was terrible. Worst hotel breakfast I have had. The pastry selection consisted of just croissants. I wouldn't mind but they were rock hard and clearly a couple of days old. The bircher museli looked like it had been sat there for hours and was hard on top- not very appealing. Then I ordered the omelette from the menu and it was the greasiest, oiliest omelette I've had...really poor standard. This is a boutique style hotel- which was OK but didn't feel at all luxurious or that comfortable to me. here are much better Sydney hotels to try.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Eferino
Reviews.Content: Would just Like to start off by saying that this is a fantastic boutique hotel. I wouldn't really rely on the previous negative reviews too much. Â Check in was absolutely smooth. Â The bellman delivered all the luggage to the room while we explored the hotel. Â The room was absolutely fantastic. Â Powder room on th lower floor. Beautiful black and white photos of sydney and the warfs past. Â Living room was quite spacious with plasma tv, large desk, sofa with pullout, arm Chair and a nice leather bench. The bedroom and the master bthroom on the second level was quite nice as well. Everything you can possibly need. Robes, slippers, tons of exta towels, plasma tv on wall and an ipod dock. Â And of course a comfortable king size bed. Many of the reviews state that the sunlight in the morning can be bithersome from the window and sky lights... There is a black out shade on the window and there are shades that retract on the skylights. So there was no problem with the sun waking you up!!! On the first night we recieved a welcome letter on leading hotels o the world stationary from the GM and a nice bottle of wine at turn down. Â (suggest booking through LHW and leaders club) There are a nice amount of restaraunts on the warf in which we ate at two. The Indian restaraunt is amazing and worth the slight price! The waterbar was really amazing and cutting edge. Be sure to ask about happy hour prices or you'll be paying a hefty amount for fabulous drinks. Â On the last night I called down for a bucket of ice to chill a bottle of wine that I had. Â It came up fast and the staff who brought it up was super friendly and asked if we needed a larger bucket beacause ahe noticed that we had a large amount of bottles on the desk ( those were from our hunter valley wine tasting tour) we laughed and declined. Â We then called down a second time to order a cheese plate. The lady who took the order accidentally sent it to the wrong room. We then recieved a phone call from room service appologized and it was soon delivered. Â The same lady who brought us our bucket of ice also delivered the platter. Â She appologized a few times and stated that it was on the house! She also asked a few times if we needed anything else to make things "wonderful". Talk about amazing service. Check out was a breeze. The concierge helped us out and was amazingly helpful with settling our bill. Â  Oh and one last tidbit of information... My boyfriend left his beautiful ring on the upstairs bedside table while we were out all day. And one day I left my passport on the desk with credit cards .... No sign of thieves at all like a previous trip advisor user!Â  This hotel was perfect in every way! Â

Reviews.Title: “We love you Blue!”
Reviews.Author: oceanroad4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Blue twice in the last year and have enjoyed the experience each time. We used the valet service and they were very well mannered and escorted us to reception and took our luggage from our car to the foyer.Reception was smooth and unhurried. Our room was gorgeous, two story loft with harbour/city views. Two televisions, giant king comfy bed...but do be aware the Voss water isn't free so avoid a costly mistake by opening it. We dine at Otto which is located a short stroll along the wharf, but have gone into the city to dine also and found that location wise it's a bit difficult to get a taxi to and from. Breakfast is great a mix of Buffet and order taken hot selection, all in all we enjoy staying here and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Typical of the excellent standard of Taj hotels throughout the world”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMush
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of Taj hotels throughout India we decided to try the Taj Blue in Woolloomooloo Sydney for a night to fit in with medical appointmants at nearby St Vincents hospital. The doorman Glen and the front nof office team member Alex were so friendly and polite on arrival. After my wife's operation she was finding it difficult to walk and Glen and Alex again came to the rescue with the offer of a wheeelchair and moe importantly mioving us from a loely double story room to an even lovelier large single story room.Room service and food were a pleasure.Thanks to all staff at the Blue.Wwe wopuild certainly stay again. Sydney mush alovely our a diouble

Reviews.Title: “theves work in this hotel! very bad service, very overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: LZSR
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for a night to escape the madness of home renovations. My husband had stayed before and enjoyed it. Whilst the hotel is nice, the rooms are modern and spacious (at a price of $379 per night so it should be) the noise coming from the patrons at the wharf kept us up most of the night, as did all the movements in the surrounding rooms. (paper thin walls!) Room service after a terrible nights sleep was unbelievably over-priced, for 1 serve of cold and wholemeal toast and a fresh juice the bill was $39. Complete and utter rip off. To add to the expense: valet parking was $40, and internet was not free, I think it was something around $30 per day, or $20 for an hour! I'm not sure why a big plush hotel needs to charge such a crazy price for wireless internet? To end off a not so pleasing stay - I left my pajamas behind in the room. I followed up immediately when I returned home (same day) and left several messages with house keeping explaining the situation, only to be ignored, so I called back a few days later to speak to the GM of the hotel who told me "they were not found in the room" which is complete rubbish as I know I left them there, so if a pair of pajamas were not returned I am sure glad that I didnt leave anything of great sentimental value or expense, behind. The manager was rude and unhelpful. Disappointing and will not be back. There are plenty of other nice hotels in sydney were I am sure they wont steal your pajamas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great service”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Set in an old warehouse building this is a beautiful hotel. The location is close to the botanic gardens and a short walk to the Opera house. The staff are extremely helpful. They gave us some great pointers on day trips to the Blue Mountains. The bar is very modern, if a little dark but has a great atmosphere when busy. The quality and number of restaurants along the wharf meant that there is not need to venture too far at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but...”
Reviews.Author: kinddog
Reviews.Content: got a nice room on second attempt having rejected a duplex which seemed rather oddly designed. Watch out for the $13 water bottle beside the bed. a rather unwelcoming touch and deeply enviromentally unfriendly as it comes from Norway! This could be a great hotel but something missing...feels short on staff and people in general in this huge lofty space, and they could and should make better use of pool and small outside space.restaurant/cafe doesn't really work either in the middle of this aircraft hangar of a building. Also...when will hotels learn that high costs for internet access drive their clients nuts. Would much rather have small surcharge on room rate everywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: dg84
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, just a 15min walk through the botanical gardens to the opera house, city centre, and circular quay for ferries. Great use of the old wharf building - makes for a spacious atmosphere and a great setting for the bar. Excellent (but not cheap) restaurants on the wharf below the restuarant. Service was welcoming and excellent throughout, even after checkout when we were encouraged to use the gym and borrow a towel before travelling onwards. Couple of minor quibbles were with the room - agree with some other reviewers comments that the lighting levels are a bit low. The bathroom was great but the door on the shower area didn't really close properly so you could flood the bathroom if not careful. Generally, however, an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: KOinCT
Reviews.Content: BLUE Sydney is a stunning hotel, and we had the best time during our 3-night stay there. I had always wanted to find a hotel with loft-style rooms, and we finally got our wish at BLUE. The 5th floor lofts were awesome! So roomy and immaculate; fun and unique. First things first: Check-in was a breeze and the staff was so kind and professional. Loved the delicious granny smith apples available at the Guest Services desk! Housekeeping and turndown service were spot-on; they never missed a beat, despite the fact that we slept in late or hung around the room in the evenings. Lots of great amenities like super-plush towels, the BEST..ROBES...EVER...and comfy slippers. The location is also fun - wonderful restaurants right around the corner, as part of the Wharf. While I wouldn't say this hotel is in the most convenient location (especially if you just want to do the touristy Harbour, Quay, Opera House stuff), it's far from inconvenient. In fact, it's just a short walk to the funky Potts Point area. And the Quay, Opera House area is still within walking distance (you hardly notice it since you're walking through the beautiful Botanic Gardens). I was a little concerned since some reviews said the area felt unsafe or dodgy, but I completely disagree. There's always people around and I never felt like my safety was compromised in any way. The Cafe du Wheels right outside the hotel is a fun alternative to the pricey Sydney cuisine, as well. This place must be a local institution, as hoards of people were sitting outside on rocks and benches savoring their hot dogs and beef pies! A fabulous stay at BLUE - I hope to return some day soon! Until then, I'll be dreaming of their ultra-comfy robes.

Reviews.Title: “High End, but not that convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lynkla
Reviews.Content: The BLUE is a lovely hotel with nice rooms, but the location leaves much to be desired. It seems they are trying to develop the area around it into a hip nightspot, but right now it is dead during the day and weeknights, and loud on weekends until the wee hours. If you are traveling high end and willing to pay for taxis to go everywhere, teh location is not as difficult, but for those using Sydney's great and economical public transport, this hotel is not convenient to train, bus or ferry transport. Busses only come once every 40-60 minutes, which means alot of waiting. It is also surrounded by a fairly empty area at night, with homeless people sleeping under bridges just a few streets away. Although Sydney is a pretty safe city no matter where you go, this is one of the more questionable sections if you are walking alone at night. For the same price, you are much better off staying somewhere in the city center, the Rocks or Darling Harbour - or down at the beaches like Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice avant garde hotel”
Reviews.Author: joandtina
Reviews.Content: Who would have thought that a hotel constructed in a disused wharf next to a naval base would be a fun exciting place to be? Well, it was really nice. The rooms were very well appointed, the fittings were a great quality, and the prices were entirely reasonable. Great restaurants downstairs as well. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyDoodleDaddy
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. The service and hotel personnel were excellent. They were extremely helpful, friendly, and attentive. Our room was very nice with a loft bedroom and views toward downtown. The location is a little removed from "The Rocks" but we do not mind a little exercise. The restaurants along the pier are also very good. We had dinner at two of them since they are so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unique style”
Reviews.Author: SamR2
Reviews.Content: Fun, conveinient ,great location and view. I very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would definitely recomend for others staying in Sydney who want a relaxing and at the same time interesting

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not quite as good as it could / should be”
Reviews.Author: liverpool200
Reviews.Content: We visited on honeymoon in February. Our inital room was large with bath and seperate shower but very dark with dirty windows. We asked to be moved which didn't seem to go down too well, we moved a few doors down the corridor to a smaller room but with much larger windows overlooking the navy habour (they were still dirty though). Drinks and food were very expensive but we liked the location out of the centre but on the water. We just got the feeling that the hotel such but a little better than it was and overall we were a bit disappointed - maybe you need to pay more and get the marina side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very special”
Reviews.Author: hubey
Reviews.Content: Booked a very reasonably priced package for my husband's 40th - $320 for loft apt with views, breakfast and cocktails. We live in Sydney so I really chose this hotel as it is so different - the ambience, architecture and history are second to none. The experience lived up to my expectations and was a wonderful surprise for my hubby. The split level room is spacious and funky but do draw the blinds at night otherwise you will be woken up early with sunlight. During the day and at sunset the city views are incredible though. Spa and pool were gorgeous and generally the service and welcome was great. Loved the Indian styled breakfast, something different is always good. If you fancy something very special the concierge will order a water taxi from just outside. One little gripe - if you stayed for a few nights the little bathroom may become annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Better experience this time around”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a few times now and this was definitely a better stay. After reading some other reviews, I ensured I stayed on the wharf side of the hotel and agree this side is much better than the other side due to - less noise - better view - no direct sunlight into the room @ dawn I've found I can get fantastic rates for the hotel on wotif.com but then if I'm in the mood to upgrade I do so directly with the hotel. Have done this twice and they observe the latest room rates shown online through the discount websites but make the changes immediately. Room service was good and the bar is great to meet people. The only downside was that Spa Chakra that is located under the hotel went into receivership a few days before I was to arrive so my highly anticpated spa day was cancelled :( Luckily I'd bookedmy spa experience through redballoon.com and they gave me a full refund. Hopefully the spa will re-open as it's in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: petalPerth
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our daughter left her hair straightening tongs in the room and I phoned late at night after we discovered them missing. The staff responded immediately, searching in the lost property and posted them to us the next day. The location is perfect , the rooms are sound proof and well equipped. The honesty and helpfulness of the staff left us with a feeling of wanting to return on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: SLMAust
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here, I got a room over the entrance so a tad noisy but only when I had to wake up anyway so no problem there. Tried to get into the gym but my card didnt seem to work so didnt bother. Great restaurants down the side there and close to the city, though I wouldnt walk through the park at night. Room service was pretty prompt and pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good, shame about everything else.”
Reviews.Author: simsalenko
Reviews.Content: Blue is a good looking hotel in a great old building. Rooms are nicely furnished and clean. BUT I have stayed twice now and will never stay again. WHY? The rooms are VERY noisy and VERY light if you are on the right side of the building. Both times I have been placed right over the boom gates for people entering in and out of the complex(not just guests - everyone who works in the complex or who has something to deliver!), and from 7.30 in the morning you will be awake. This isnt helped by the blinds not meeting so they light streams in from 7am. This was the same in both rooms! Also while I stayed painting was going on along the outside so from 9am there is the constant sound of a truck reversing right outside the window. When I checked in the 2nd time I received a letter informing me of this and letting me know I could switch rooms. Knowing what a pain it was I asked to move to the other side of the building. I was then informed I could move for another $75. Thanks for nothing! DO NOT STAY ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THIS HOTEL. Dont stay here if you want to have a nice lesiurely stay where you can sleep in or get a peaceful sleep. The painting is only part of the issue as the other hotel issues are all day every day. Avoid this hotel as there are much better options in Sydney with better service and better designed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position, Amazing building, one or two issues”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller024
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Blue several times. Up until a year ago I lived in Sydney so am very familiar with Sydney & Sydney hotels and I do love a really good hotel. Would go so far as to say I am extremely particular/fussy. I have usually stayed in the rafter rooms, which are at the cheaper end of their rooms and at front of hotel, so now view. However for all its little faults, I chose to stay there when in Sydney as the building is gorgeous being a former wharf. Its walking distance to the fabulous Boy Charlton Swimming Pool, the Botanic Gardens, the City, plus a short journey anyway in central Sydney or North Sydney or the Eastern Suburbs etc, very easy to get on all the freeways that go further out. The restaurants along the wharf are sensational. Possibly why their own bar is a bit empty which is unfortunate. There are some issues with the rooms, due to the nature of the building. The loft rooms are a bit of an odd layout, but are enormous. The breakfast could be improved - great fresh juices, great coffee, great cooked eggs etc but bircher muesli and porride a bit boring. The gym is small, but still useable. If you love running well perfect, just head up to Botanical Gardens. Swimming excellent at Boy Charlton. I stayed at the Sydney Hilton last time, but though the hotel just renovated, and the food/restaurant amazing, I personally preferred being out of the central business discrict in the city. This location hard to beat. The price at the time was nearly half the hilton for the room I chose. I

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W”
Reviews.Author: downunderfirsttimer
Reviews.Content: The most amazing loft style room , great sea views , cool bar , great food, dont want add more as you should experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Check Your Bill”
Reviews.Author: archerymart
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a loft apartment. About average for Sydney prices but well located on a wharf into the harbour and walking distance to the city. Warning. Check your bill; we were charged for breakfast and the use of the bar. After contacting the hotel they did refund the breakfast, but failed to credit the bar which we had not used. As a traveller with a daughter in the area we ate opposite for half the price at Charlies and purchased water there for $3. Be warned, check your account.

Reviews.Title: “No Blues at the Blue”
Reviews.Author: dougalHorsham
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 3 wonderful nights at the Blue. My daughter and husband surprised me with a quick trip to Sydney and 3 nights at the Blue Hotel. From the moment we left the taxi to check out we were amazed at the service. Very friendly and ever so quick checkin and a guided tour of our loft room and we were settled in. We didn't want to leave our room for the obligatory sightseeing. We were way too cosy and yes we were on the wrong side of the hotel. Not an issue, loved watching the crowds eating at Harry's Cafe and just generally people watching. Loved the opening windows and subsequent breeze through the room. Bed one of the comfiest I have slept in and the pillows the best I have ever encountered. As mentioned by previous reviewers the Water Bar is fabulous and the cocktails brilliant. Loved the candles throughout and the most amazing view one gets when coming down in the glass walled lifts in the evening. Breakfast each morning was great and once again the staff shone out. If I had to complain about anything it would perhaps be housekeeping which is a little spasmodic. Coffee Plungers left dirty, facewashers not replaced, sugars and teas not replaced. I know they are minor issues but really shouldn;t occur in a 5 star hotel. That aside we had a brilliant weekend at the Blue and would definitely be returning when next in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JLM71
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 5 nights and had the most amazing time! The room was in incredibly luxurious, clean with a great view over the water. The bar is fantastic, very stylish, full of atmosphere and the cocktails were great. Ask for the "whatever, whenever" button make sure you give that a go! The staff where very helpful and friendly. Well worth the money and when I return to Sydney I will not stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevePER
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights at the Blue for business. I found it was a level above the other hotels nearby that I've stayed in before. The hotel is stylish and very well presented, and the room is comfortable. There are also great views from the city-facing rooms. The hotel is in a converted warehouse, which makes the interior of the hotel (apart from the guest rooms) cold in winter. This is solved partially by many outdoor heaters, but it isn't ideal. It's particularly noticeable when eating at the cafe for breakfast. They don't have a buffer here. This is my favourite hotel of the six I've stayed in nearby, and I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: hk_me
Reviews.Content: I finally got a chance to stay at this hotel. I have so many friends from the Sydney area and they always talk about it. It has a lot of history. I liked the way the developer have tried to keep the some or the historic items of the wharf when they converted it to a hotel. We had the old exposed beams running across our room and the old conveyor belt was outside our door. Added to these items were all the modern amenities that are needed in a five star hotel. We did have some issues with trying to get meals and coffee throughout the day. I could never understand when the restaurants was going to be open our closed. There are a number of other pubs, cafes and restaurants in the area. We used Blue as our base to visit the tourist areas of Sydney. It was a nice walk to get to the CBD, Opera house and the Bridge. I was a little worried on the first night when the staff didn't recommend that we walk in the area of the hotel at night. It had me a little apprehensive, but everything is also a close taxi ride. The staff are good, but there are not many of them around. I travel a lot in Asia so I am a bit spoiled for five star hotel staff attention.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: trib22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at BLUE four times now - three for business and once on a weekend away with my wife and daughter. Every time I've been treated well and looked after by attentive staff. The trip with my family saw us in one of their best rooms which suited us very well. On two of my business trips, the hotel has upgraded me to a better room, which has been very nice. The only minor issues I've had is that the blinds tend to be a little worn and uneven when you raise and lower them and on one visit, the room wasn't as thoroughly cleaned as I'd like - still clean, but not to the standard I've seen before. As a business hotel, it's a little out of the city, but worth it for the better facilities at what is usually a really good price - looking on Wotif or HotelClub will usually get you a great rate. The concierge advised me last visit to call the hotel and quote the Wotif price in order to get an even better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Different Experience”
Reviews.Author: nerekdart
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I still thought I would give this hotel a go as they had an excellent price on wotif. I enjoyed the brief walk from the city to the hotel. I found the hotel design very unique. Check in staff were excellent and unusually helpful. The reception and entrance were dark but not sterile. My room (501) was excellent - clean, a good size and in good condition. The 'mini bar' was an amazing offering - but very expensive. The main bar looked fantastic and the servive was excellent. However this was almost deserted - in fact during my visit it almost felt like I was one of a dozen staying at the hotel. If I got a great rate again I would definately stay here again. Much better than your normal boring executive room box you get in the central city area. Oh - and did I mention the down bedding!

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great looking building, extremely professional employees, a real treat!!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda souless”
Reviews.Author: MrsBANNISTER
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotels, in my opinion, are meant not only to provide you with evertything you need for comfort and convienience but to involke a sense of luxury and indulgence. Blue seemes to have everything but maybe its the vast space of the building, the decoration or the fact that thing are a bit worn on close inspection but this didnt really cut it for me. There was dust on the pictures, bath tiles were scruffy, tap was wobbly, hot water took ages to heat up, mini bar very over priced. Staff were friendly, room service ladies actually made it for me they wre so jolly and wonderful. The food was pretty average though. Location ok if you want the walk. Out of 10 against other 5 stars Ive stayed in Id give it a 7 and no I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel???? I dont think so!”
Reviews.Author: Paris069
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me start by saying how terribly disappointed I was the Blue Hotel. I have just returned to Melbourne after spending two nights at Blue. How on earth they have managed to classify themselves as a 5 star hotel is completely beyond me - perhaps back in the day when the hotel first opened - but in this day and age 5 star they certaintly are not. The official website even boasts about the award they won in 2005!! Its not 2005 anymore its now 2008 move on!! I made my booking 3 weeks prior to our stay and because May is classified as "low season" I really didnt expect to have any problems. The day prior to arriving I called the hotel to double check my booking - they had no record on the computer of my reservation - the girl I spoke to went "out the back" to look through the paperwork and sure enough there was my reservation which had been forgotten about (in her words). The next day when I arrived with my partner we were greeted at the front desk by a girl who was not only dressed very badly but had no idea what she was doing. We were given a key to the third floor and on arrival found out that it defiantly was not the room I had booked. We went back downstairs to tell the girl at front reception who was very confused. She then attempted to find the room I had booked and got it wrong again!! After the third try we finally got our room. How disappointing - the room was anything but "5 star luxury" as is described by many websites. There were scuffs all over the walls, paint chipping off corners, scuffs on the down stairs mirror and the furniture was looking a little worse for wear. There were blue faux fur cushions on the couch that were old and matted while on our bed lay an old, pilled electric blue arcylic blanket. The paint job in the main room and the bathroom looked very cheap. But perhaps the worst thing about the hotel is on the 5th floor where the ceiling is very low as you walk up (or down) two steps into the alcove before your rooms front door. My partner who is 6ft tall was walking out the front door - the alcove has no lighting (this only comes on later at night) - he began to walk down the steps and did not see the low bearing ceiling - he hit this so hard he landed on his back on the steps with a big gash to his head. The next day he also had a very sore neck. We went downstair to tell the girl at the front desk and all she could say was "oh!!!! oops!!!!" There are no signs anywhere to warn tall people to look out for the low ceilings and low beams. If this had been an older person then they may have done some serious damage to themselves. I would not recommend anyone I know to stay at the Blue Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sfkkyy
Reviews.Content: After a very long over night flight we arrived at the hotel utterly exhausted at 8 in the morning. To our great relief the room was ready for us and the reception clerk was very nice & helpful with ideas of where to eat and what to do in the area. The bellman was there to help with the bags and made sure we had a taxi when needed. Our room was modern with enough room to move around. The beds were very comfortable -- the best we encountered on our trip. Also a good-sized TV and club chair + table with a view of the wharf and street. It was clean and well maintained. The windows kept the street noise out even though we were facing the wharf/street. We did occasionally hear some of the other guestâ€™s doors closing in the hallway. The bathroom had a nice aesthetic, but the sink was definitely more form than function. The shower was good and the tub was large and comfortable. Excellent counter space and storage. The area had a solid choice of restaurants close by. We liked Charlie's across the street for breakfast; for dinner, take a 10 minute walk up the steps to the Potts Point area, we found several good restaurants there -- much more reasonably priced than those right next to the hotel on the wharf. Very positive experience, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamDaytripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the start of a holiday visiting friends living in Sydney, and loved every minute. After battling through the rain from the airport, we had a warm welcome from all the reception staff, and fantastic service in the bar where the "mixologist" recommended cocktails...just the thing to help us get over to sleep after a long flight! The rooms are very comfortable and the view made the long flight from London fade into distant memory! The location was great too...didn't feel like being in the city but only a short walk through the botanic gardens to the opera house! Much nicer than the CBD. Would recommend the restaurants on the wharf for a treat...where the service is friendly, and you can get there without getting your hair wet! The only negatives...the weather - wettest for over 10 years!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BlackCatz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King Duplex room for 4 nights and couldn't have wished for a better start to our holiday in Australia. Check in was efficient with staff very helpful. The room was great: large living area with a spectacular view towards the city, and a mezzanine bedroom with a very comfortable bed. Both the bedroom and the living areas had flat panel TV screens. The bathroom was next to the bedroom with an extra WC on the lower floor. Walking off the jetlag was easy given the BLUE's location in Wolloomooloo: it's a short walk to the botanical gardens and the Opera House and very quick to trot up to the Art Gallery of New South Wales (well worth a visit). The wharf location of the hotel is replete with Sydney's best (if rather expensive) restaurants (Aki's Indian was some of the best Indian food we've ever had) and there are plenty of other choices in the immediate area. The bar in the BLUE opens from 4pm and is more focused on cocktails and wine than beer, which suited us fine. Clientele were a mix of those staying at the hotel and business types, and prices were high but the cocktails (I recommend the Emburey Martini) great. The bar also has a tapas-style menu -- again, prices are not cheap but the quality and quantity is worth it. Room service was also worth trying: this was the best in-room dining we'd ever had. Other elements of the service were fine: valet parking was efficient and the front desk dealt with my queries quickly. A missing bathrobe was replaced in a couple of minutes, for example. Check out was fast and efficient. Overall, the BLUE is probably one of the best hotels we've stayed at, combining high quality service with a great location if you don't mind stretching your legs for the walk into the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Room spacious and slick, reception staff good but restaurant left a lot to be de”
Reviews.Author: Tas-wanderer
Reviews.Content: I arrived late into Sydney and was delivered to Blue at Woolloomooloo by my taxi. I was impressed by the check in. My bag was whisked out of the taxi and the staff escorted me to the hotel receptionâ€¦had to go up some stairs to reception so not sure how disabled people get thereâ€¦.check in was very good with a very nice lay back atmosphere and I was very quickly in my room. The room was really spacious with very pleasant dÃ©cor of white walls, white blinds and very crisp white linen on the bed. This was complemented by dark brown desk and benches, chaise lounge and seat at the end of the bed and the original structures of the building which gives it a really great feel. The first effect was one of yes this is nice!!! Nice touches of coffee plunger and small packs of coffee to make the ubiquitous pot of coffee â€¦very, very nice. The fridge was very well stocked â€¦.a bit of a laugh were some of the things one could purchase from the stocks in the roomâ€¦.large container of lubricating gel and the likeâ€¦. which was different. Bed was just so wonderfully comfortable!!!! Need to take that home with me!!! The flat screen TV was excellent, not that the offerings on the TV were very interestingâ€¦not the fault of the hotel. The bathroom on first appearance was very slick but when you looked a little closer there was mould and rust in the shower bayâ€¦needs some maintenance!!. Shower was excellent with the water wonderfully hot!!! The view from the room is over the water which is always pleasant to see the movement of boats on the water although as it is a pier the view is not expansiveâ€¦.but very much nicer than looking at brick walls or rusty roofs. Downside: The service when having breakfast was not good, very tardy and very slow and the cost of the breakfast is unbelievably highâ€¦.Go for a wander to some of the other eateries around and you will get a far better breakfast and far better service!!! Upside: The staff on reception were most organised, pleasant and always ready with a smile and genuinely were happy to help with any request re storage of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Hotel - Something missing”
Reviews.Author: NorwichJools
Reviews.Content: Having read one bad review of this hotel I was hoping to be prooved wrong - unfortunately I was not! The room was tired - the handle of the fridge broken. Dirty tape stuck to the floor of the shower. Went to the bar for a drink and bar staff were rude, unhelpful and then charged a standard 10% for tip. During my 4 week trip to Australia this was the only disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A tired and expensive hostel.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromBris
Reviews.Content: This is no luxury option. Sure the rooms were a great size, but they were tired and tatty on the edges. The service was insanely non-existent (could reception staff move any slower and look any LESS interested?). During my stay i never really felt that i was in any way getting service, that the hotel was doing me a favour allowing me to stay in their bland 'art' space with their indifferent and casual attitude. This is not a hotel, it's an expensive place to crash. I felt like a teenager.

Reviews.Title: “Style and substance”
Reviews.Author: BowTom31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week after travelling to Melbourne, Adelaide and Alice Springs. The building is an amazing warehouse conversion but lacks a heart. The room was great with a huge bed and a good sized marble bathroom. The view was magnificent with the Sydney skyline perched above the art gallery, and the top of the harbour bridge just visible through the trees of the botanic garden. The wharfside restaurants were good and we got into Otto the same day as we booked. The bar was an interesting space, it's just a shame that none of the cheaper beers were available and the opening hours were so short. The reception is up a flight of steps - not good for disabled travellers. Reception staff were helpful and the free internet terminal in reception was very useful. Breakfast was a sorry affair, so cross the road to the very friendly Charlies cafe for fresh coffee and food at a fraction of the cost of the hotel. An interesting hotel which thrives on its style but felt a bit empty.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel fashion”
Reviews.Author: TONEMALONE
Reviews.Content: Blue used to be called the W, this chain is part of the larger American chain of hotels called Starwood. During the later part of 2006 the hotel changed hands the standard of service has not changed and you can still expect the best. The hotel has a very good location on the otherside of the Botanical Gardens and is a mere 15mins walk to the Opera House. The main reason to stay at this hotel is to boast to your friends that you are indeed posh and like to live it up! The hotel is situated just on the waterfront but further away from Circular Quay, please dont let this put you off! Inside the hotel is a club/bar and is probably one of the most amazing places to be on a Saturday night... the noise from this will not affect your nights sleep as the rooms are completely sound proofed. The access to the rooms is by the exclusive keycard system (both for the rooms and the lifts). To sum up stay here if you want somewhere different that is going to really impress.

Reviews.Title: “for new year.....”
Reviews.Author: trishEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: ..we arrived here on new years eve which is just a wow in sydney. loved the location of here next to botanic gardens and gentle walk to opera house etc. accomodation is good and we had a loft apartment with separate sitting area which was great. all would've been fine if this was 3 or poss 4 max star. restaurants underneath blue are v. good - china doll, indian etc. we'd booked when it was still W brand. Did feel that in general place could so with bit of upgrading. Conceigre service was really poor and we had to chase them to make sure bookings were made. Would v. recommend le kiosk at manly beach and aria at circular quay and getting water taxi there. loved sydney and would go back but would stay elsewhere as this doesn't live up to star rating!

Reviews.Title: “amazing in everyway and the odd celeb thrown in!!”
Reviews.Author: janine-7
Reviews.Content: bein gin Sydney for the new year we struggled a year in advance to get accommodation through our tour agent but they managed to pull this one out of the bag and wow did they do well. This is a truely stunning hotel, amazing restaurants and fab location. we had 10 nights here and never a dull moment including Paris Hilton creating mayhem at the Otto restaurant rated one of sydneys top 5 conveniently located downstairs. The restaurants are full of the beautiful crowd but the wharf setting is just delightful and those of you who run the jog from the hotel around the bay to circular quay and the botanical gardens just washes all you stresses away. could not fault this hotel at all. Agree with previous comments tho some fab little eateries accross the road from the hotel which do great brekfasts. A real must hotel

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberAsia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights for business at the Blue Sydney. As one of the previous posters already mentioned, the architecture (old wharf building, beautifully restored) mixed with the sleek and modern design and clever lighting is very unique and gives this â€œindustrial feelâ€�. My room was modern too, with clean lines, huge writing desk (perfect for working). I had booked a loft room with a living area downstairs and upstairs a bedroom & bathroom. Everywhere you will find beautiful old black and white pictures showing scenes from gone by eras in Sydney. Check out the bar (I was told one of the top voted bars in Sydney) â€“ plenty of good restaurants just around the corner too. Nice pool & gym, generally very good service. My 2 thumbs up for a pretty unique hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Blue...Twice”
Reviews.Author: Armatrak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in July 06 both times for 5 days while working at the Sydney Opera House. Great hotel, really good and well trained staff. Watch out for the loudness of the bar and the early closing of the bar, which ever is your priority. Check out the little breakfast place accross the street, Charlie's the best. Great restaurants outside and on the side of this unique property. Oh and Harry's De wheels is right there, not to leave out the Botanical gardens at your doorstep

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing Architecture and Ambience”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: This is a most unusual hotel and experience. The rooms are the slickest contemporary rooms I have experienced full of textures and with fine view over the harbour. The hotel is situation inside a VAST structure that is more than cathedral like. The consequence is that the communal inner space has a marvelous industrial feel but is so vast it is mostly unusable. There is a bar and cafe - breakfast in the cafe was a poor affair characterised by poor service and mediocre food - once experienced not to be repeated. There is a swimming pool\ but few people manage to find it in the building and there is no guidance in the rooms (perhaps due to the new ownership?). Overall the experience is positive. The location is convenient being right next to the Botanical Gardens and there are a variety of local eating places either on the dockside within the building or vicinity. The hotel seemed out of style for a Taj Hotel and one wonders if such an unusual space can be made to work effectively as a business. But try it and enjoy..its certainly a wow.

Reviews.Title: “An unbelievable experience!”
Reviews.Author: Llaumig
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Sydney where I stayed for 7 nights in the Blue Woolloomooloo. I have to concur in every way with the previous review, namely that the hotel is amazing and that some of the critics are too harsh. I travel very regularly on business and hence have experienced good hotels. This one is reall great. The staff if young, friendly and professional. The rooms - I had a duplex with marina view - is well organised and equipped. The gym and swimming pool are equally good. The bar has a very nice atmosphere. And equally importantly the business district is a 10min walk away through the park i.e. close enough to work but far away enough to leave the business atmosphere behind in the evenning and relax. I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a stylish/boutique hotel close to the business district.

Reviews.Title: “So it's NOT a W?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago,while I was staying there I got into a discussion with a staff member of W chicago about why W hotels were becoming such a hip, cool and trendy thing. And that is the culture of collecting experiences, perhaps in a Hard Rock Cafe kind of way but less cheesy. Thing is, you expect the same high quality from all Ws but with each one being a unique experience. Each hotel is furnished and decorated in a style which suits the buildings or the city. I had stayed at W Sydney perhaps twice before during conferences and whatnot and it did differ from W in the US. It didnt feel as warm, but the Blue Whisky bars (at all W hotels) was really an experience. When I stayed at Blue, I guess I was expecting more. Gone is the 'Whatever, Whenever' motto, something I had developed a tendancy to make use of. The interior has changed a bit from what I remember and somehow it feels more icy. The service doesnt seem to emphasise all the things they used to. I waited something like an hour and a half for room service. The bartenders didn't know many of their cocktails. The people don't seem to be as friendly. In fact, it feels like they're no longer proud to work there. In my experience people working at W are very proud of its hipness and trendiness, and even though it might be a facade, to the customer thats all we want: attentive service. I know many of you might think I'm obsessed with the hotel brand, but isn't it piece of mind that you DONT worry how bad your hotel will be if you've never been there. Staying at a hotel is a gamble, even the brand name ones. At this price, you should think you've got that piece of mind, but guess what? I dont think i'll be going back. The rooms are fine, albeit getting a little rundown, but for what you pay at that price you aren't paying for the room, the view or anything like that. You are paying for the comfort,luxury and convenience, which means service. By W standards ( and I'm aware it's not W, but it is W PRICES), this does not measure up in anyway. I would have given it 5 according to my past experiences, but as Blue, I give it 3. Please consider the price and what you could get at other boutique hotels. I recommend Establishment Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ukboi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in Jan 06, prior to the change of ownership to Taj Hotels. I was not notified by Starwood until the day prior to my arrival that it was no longer a W Hotel. The Blue Hotel is a great base to explore Sydney, you can walk to the CBD, Harbour, etc and the nearest train station is ten minutes walk at the most. The rooms are starting to look a bit tired, but the standard of house keeping was very high. My room was on the top floor so there was a reasonable view of the area. The Hotel's famous bar, was the biggest let down. The in crowd appear to have moved on, leaving a few customers behind wondering why it's not busy. Supping expensive drinks and listening to weird music. It also closes by 1 am , which is a bit weird when you come from Europe and most decent places only get going by this time . All in all the Blue is a good base, clean rooms but it's nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SPKSF
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVED the Blue hotel. Perfect for the late 20s-40s age groups, couples, honeymooners, and friends. Great location and about a 10 minute walk to the Opera house. The wharf building that the hotel is located in has an excellent range of restaurants and the Sydney explorer buses stop right in front of the hotel so easy for sightseeing and catching taxis. The bar in the hotel lobby is the best one we went to...all sorts of great drinks such as the blueberry mojito (my favorite). The rooms are very roomy with wonderful views of the wharf and the Botanic gardens. Great staff and hospitality. Will always stay there when I visit next...other top-rated hotels might be closer to the Opera house or the Darling Harbour but this one is the best overall experience and is in a better location in my opinion. What a great trip...sydney is my favorite place of all!!

Reviews.Title: “changing the sign as i entered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at whotel 3 times in the past..booked internet rate in oct2005 for feb2006 2 day stay(traveling from honolulu..starwood pref guest..went to check in..it's now the blue hotel taj..change hands the day before ..no one e-mailed me..told me of the change..dif.not the same..no points..diff. room that i booked and paid for...i would booked the four seasons had i been told..but monies are up front..so very --- off... i just wrote corp. regarding my feeling...aviod the blue taj....
